loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old, married and has four children between 1 and 14 years old. Currently two of his children attend school. 

Samuel sells boutique items including mandazi (a pastry), clothes for ladies, biscuits, etc. He has done this for four years. His wife helps him in the business. 

Samuel will use the loan to purchase more cooking oil, soaps, salt, rice, hand bags, paper bags, lotions and other items. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Kanykei's Group

texts.en:
In contemporary Kyrgyzstan, grocery stores, supermarkets and bazaars are mostly accessible in main cities and towns. In small villages and other centers of population, one can get consumer goods only from small shops, which every village has. 

Kanykei M., 26, is a member of this group. A year ago she spent her savings on building a small shop for consumer goods by her house in a small town of Toktogul. Every week she buys goods wholesale and sells them to the local population. The starting capital of 20,000 KGS was taken from the salary of her husband, who is a cab driver. Now Kanykei makes 5,000 KGS monthly, but because of the constantly rising costs of groceries, transportation and taxes, Kanykei is not succeeding in covering her costs. 

She is applying for a loan in order to cover all her expenses and broaden the assortment in her shop. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Hamidakhon

texts.en:
Hamidakhon J. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Twenty-five years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of space she had available on their land for this business. 

Hamidakhon is engaged in this business together with her family. Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, the requests of her clients increased. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Ian Maina

texts.en:
Ian, 56, is a hardworking man. He is supporting one child and they live in a place called Kabuku, in Limuru town, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi city. He sells charcoal and firewood which is used mainly for fuel by the locals of this area.

He has been running this business for 16 years and he finds it profitable. This is the fourth loan he has received from KADET and he intends to use it to buy more charcoal and firewood for sale so he can expand his business. He also plans to build a better shed from where he will sell the charcoal. 

If the loan improves his business, he hopes to supply the neighbouring schools and colleges with firewood and provide a good education for his child.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal and to construct a shed or a stall for his business.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DRISSA D. a  43 ans, monogame et père de trois enfants dont  2 garçons et 1 fille. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après avoir échoué à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation des céréales et de la vente du miel il y a 15 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes , mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant  1 an  et a bénéficié d’un  prêt qui a été correctement remboursé. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ainsi ce deuxième prêt au niveau de l’institution qui lui permettra d’acheter, 40 bidons de 20 litres de miel, 5 tonnes de maïs et  20 sacs de mil. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso et les stocke dans son magasin situé au nouveau du marché de  Médine Sikasso, ensuite  les revend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa D. is 43 years old, he is monogamous and the father of three children, two boys and a girl. He lives with his wife and their children in Medine, a popular quarter in the village of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

After dropping out of school he quickly took up the business of storage and sale of cereal grains and honey. He has 15 years in the business. With this level of experience in the field, he enjoys a solid reputation and receives many orders, but he lacks the necessary resources to satisfy the demand. Therefore he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) last year and he received a first loan, which has already been repaid. 

With the goal of satisfying his growing clientele, he requests a second loan from institution. He will be able to purchase 40 twenty-liter containers of honey, 5 tons of corn, and 20 sacks of millet. 

He makes his purchases in the surrounding regions of Sikasso and he stores the products in his store located in the market of Medine Sikasso. He resells to a clientele made up of both men and women, in retail and wholesale.

With the help of this loan he expects to make a monthly income of 150000FCFA. These earnings will be used to provide for his basic needs and those of his family, to pay the interest of his loan and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains and honey.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Honey is the pride of all beekeepers and one of the most valuable products on every Kyrgyz table. Honey collected high in the mountains possesses rare vitamins and a unique taste. 

Gulmira K., 53, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, a construction worker, have their own apiary. All day long they work hard to provide proper care for the bees. Honey has always been a means of good health for the entire family. 

Five years ago, Gulmira got the idea that her product could also be a profitable source of revenue. She started offering the product to her neighbors and acquaintances, and soon the demand became very high, and now she has regular customers. 

Recently she decided to attempt the export of honey to the neighboring country of Kazakhstan. For this purpose, Gulmira would like to get a loan of 20,000 KGS. She believes in a bright future for her business and expects to successfully repay the loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase honey

loans.name: Munar's Group

texts.en:
Group loans are loans given to a number of people, each one of whom gets his own portion and is responsible for paying it back. In case one team member defaults, the other members are responsible for repaying that part of the loan.

Munar J., 56, is the leader of this group. She’s been a high school teacher for many years. After her sons left to live on their own, Munar and her husband had more time to take care of their household. Munar’s husband has been a professional stock-breeder for a long time. Over fifteen years, the couple have raised and resold hundreds of head of cattle. 

Now they get about $64 a month, which is barely enough to cover the cost of feeding the stock. Munar has organized this group and requests a loan for purchasing more cattle and expanding the business. When she gets high returns, she would like to purchase a small piece of land to try herself in agriculture. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Mirzokhuja

texts.en:
Mirzokhuja supports his wife and three children by driving a taxi in the Northern Tajikistan city of Isfara. He has been driving a taxi for around two years and has a good reputation among his fellow taxi drivers. He works hard and is a positive influence on others. 

Currently his car requires frequent maintenance. He would like a loan of 6,000 TJS to use for buying spare parts for car maintenance. We are happy for the opportunity to help him improve his business and position himself for a successful future.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the maintenance of his car

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Issa D.  40 ans, polygame et père de six  enfants dont 4 garçons et 2 filles, il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de Pois Sucré, noix de karité et de céréales il y a 10 ans. Avec cette grande expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et renommée et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. 
Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant  2 ans  et a bénéficié  de trois prêts qui ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième prêt au niveau de l’institution qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 sacs de pois sucré, 3 tonnes de maïs, 5 sacs de mil et 10 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso et les stocke dans son magasin situé au nouveau marché de  Médine Sikasso, ensuite il les ramène à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement dans les république de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beure de karité. Il vend les céréales à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is 40 years old, he is polygamous and the father of six children, 4 boys and 2 girls. He lives with his four wives and their children in Medine, a popular quarter in the village of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried many different business activities without success, notably agriculture and others, he soon started out the business of storage and sale of sweet peas, shea nuts, and cereal grains. He has been 10 years in the business. With this great amount of experience in the field, he enjoys a solid reputation and fame, and he receives many out of country orders. But he lacks the necessary resources to satisfy the demand.

Therefore he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) two years ago and since then he has accessed three loans, all of which were successfully repaid. 

With the goal of satisfying the demand of an ever growing clientele, he requests a fourth loan from the institution. He will be able to purchase 10 sacks of sweet peas, 3 tons of corn, 5 sacks of millet, and 10 sacks of shea nuts. 

He makes his purchases in the surrounding regions of Sikasso and he stores the products in his store located in the new market of Medine Sikasso. He later transports the products to Abidjian and Bobo Dioulasso (located in the Republic of Ivory Coast and Burkina Faso, respectively) on demand from sweet pea juice factories and shea butter factories. He sells cereal grains both on wholesale and in retail. 

With the help of this loan he expects to earn a monthly income of 200 000FCFA. This income will serve to provide for his basic needs and those of his family, as well as to repay his loan and to invest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase sweet peas and shea nuts.

loans.name: Kulsiyna's Group

texts.en:
Since ancient times the Kyrgyz people have been some of the best livestock breeders and farmers. Leading a nomadic lifestyle, they have worked out special strategies for raising healthy cattle high in the Kyrgyz mountains.

Kulsiyna K., 44, is the leader of this group, consisting of four experienced and ambitious cattle-breeders. Five years ago, having some savings and a big desire to start a successful business, she had to decide where to invest her start up capital. A widow with three sons living apart, Kulsiyna started with purchasing just a few head of cattle. She would feed and look after them carefully and go to the nearest stockyard to sell them. 

Soon she found out that the more carefully you look after cattle, the more productive you are going to be. Over these years she’s been quite successful, and now that she is more confident and experienced, she would like to try raising sheep and goats, which are also in high demand. 

Kulsiyna hopes to obtain the loan in order to purchase sheep and goats, since a monthly income of about $44 is unfortunately not enough. In the future she would like to help her sons arrange nice wedding ceremonies with lots of guests and good memories. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mwanapili Masha

texts.en:
Mwanapili Masha B. is a 49-year-old lady. She is married to Raymond and together they have six children.  Mwanapili has been a charcoal dealer for the past eleven years. 

This marks her second loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business. The anticipated profits will be directed into her children’s education. 

Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is married with three children. She runs a pharmaceutical business. She owns one small pharmaceutical kiosk and sells medications to retail clients. She launched this business eight years ago. 

Marhabo is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to purchase assorted pharmaceuticals for the cold season, when viruses, cold and flu lead to increased spending on medications. 

Her business is the main source of income for the family and her husband is also actively involved in the business. She is hoping to continue to develop her business one day by opening several more pharmaceutical kiosks.

loans.use: To purchase more medications for expanding the business

loans.name: Rakhat's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyz families are typically large. Strong family ties and love of children are the main drivers to having large and friendly families. As children grow up, the oldest one in a tribe divides the inheritance according to the number of children and their skills.

Rakhat J., 59, a divorced mother of six, is the leader of this group. For her whole life, Rakhat’s children have been a great stimulus to work and find her own path in life. For 20 years she has been involved in livestock raising, and over time has significantly broadened her business by purchasing dozens of heads of livestock. Currently she earns 3000 soms monthly, but a recent leap in prices means that her can barely cover her costs. Rakhat would like to spend her part of the loan to purchase livestock, resell them at a good price, and start planning inheritance procedures for her six children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF) a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
E. Manzura is 48 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. Manzura sells dried fruits in the central local market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan - all hostesses have dried fruits in storage to serve in case her family has guests. Moreover, dried fruits are served as a rule during all family occasions, such as weddings and birthday parties. Considering the constant demand for these goods Manzur's business is quite successful and provides a stable income for her family. Today Manzura requests 7,500 Somoni to purchase dried fruits to increase the range of goods she is selling. Manzura has already demonstrated herself as a good client with positive credit history, but she would also like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase dried fruits in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is a very small country and airlines function only in a few cities, which means the majority of transportation is by land. Since it takes several hours to drive from one town to another, taxi driving is a way of earning money for thousands of men.

Bakhtiyar J. U., 20, is one of the members of this group. He’s a resident of a small town with a population of 16 000, called Toktogul. Bakhtiyar was not lucky enough to obtain a university education, so he had to search for a job right after his high school graduation. Cars have been his passion since early childhood. After getting his driver’s license, he decided that his favorite occupation, driving, could also be a good means of revenue. Bakhtiyar’s taxi route is between Toktogul-Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). He has acquired regular clients and drives up to 600 kilometers per route. Bakhtiyar sees his car as a main source of income, so he requested a loan in order to replace the engine and some parts. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Saiyohat

texts.en:
M. Saiyohat is 46 years old. She is married with 5 children. Saiyohat sells fodder for animals in the market. The generated income from her business is mainly used to purchase small bulls for raising and selling. Now Saiyohat is applying for a loan of 7500 Somoni. She is planning on increasing the working capital of the business in order for it to expand, and to use the generated income to start a private farm for breeding cattle. Saiyohat thanks all who support her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To increase working capital in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Ziyodakhon

texts.en:
Ziyodakhon S. is married and has two grown children. She lives in Kanibadam, Tajikistan. 

Ziyodakhon runs a small business selling general goods in the local market. Her business place is located on the main market where there are many customers every day. Ziyodakhon has been in business for more than 12 years. 

Ziyodakhon is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. Her professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of her business. 

Ziyodakhon is requesting a loan for 6,000 TJS to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She is hoping that this loan will help her venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Ziyodakhon's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow her to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods for selling

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Mme Akouya  est âgée de 67 ans et a 4 enfants. Elle est née à Togoville et habite quartier Abobogomé. Elle est revendeuse de poissons fumés au marché local Abobogomé. Elle a démarré ses activités en 1990 et s’approvisionne au marché d’Atikpodji. Elle sollicite un prêt pour l’achat de 6 paniers de poissons fumés adiado, 20 paniers  de poissons fumés tilabia, et 6 paniers de poissons fumés djémékpè.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouya is 67 years old and she has 4 children. She was born in Togoville and she lives in the quarter of Abobogome. She is a smoked fish retailer in local market of Abobogome. She took up her business in 1990 and she makes her purchases in the Atikpodji market. She requests a loan to purchase 6 baskets of adiado, tilabia, and djemekpe smoked fish.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of smoked fish.

loans.name: Kanymkul

texts.en:
Kanymkul K.  is 40 and married. Kanymkul is the mother of four children: two sons who live on their own, and two daughters of school age. 

After graduating from an industrial college, she worked as a shop assistant in the local area, but her wage was too low to cover all the family's expenses. In 1994, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Kanymkul decided to begin her sales business. 

Being a very persistent person, she concentrated all her efforts and achieved success. Kanymkul managed to obtain a selling place at the local market. She sells a wide assortment of foodstuffs. With the revenues, she has been able to pay for the education of her sons and hold the marriage of the elder one. 

As Kanymkul’s activity started successfully and her clientele has increased, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 KGS to broaden the range of goods in her shop. With the revenues, she plans to give a good education to her daughters.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the range of goods

loans.name: Amos Musita

texts.en:
Amos Musita A. is a 46-year-old man. He is single and the father of four children. Amos has been in the transport business for the last two years. 

This marks his second loan from KADET Ltd., and he plans to repair and service his motorcycle. The anticipated profits will be directed to his children’s education. His dream is to own another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba B. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. 

For 20 years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread “lepeshka”. It has now become the family business, as the children of Mahbuba are grown and they are helping their mother. 

Mahbuba is a cheerful, hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid 12 loans from IMON, which have helped create stability for her business. Today, Mahbuba is requesting for a loan of 7500 TJS. She is planning to purchase the flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales and earn more so she can provide her children with a good education.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a widow and has four children. She processes palm oil and palm kernel oil. Her customers are requesting palm kernel oil in larger quantities. Therefore, Esi wants to use the loan to expand her business. She uses the income from her sales to see to the well-being of her family.  She plans to educate her children with the additional income.

loans.use: To expand her palm kernel oil business

loans.name: Senkenoi Ene Letiti

texts.en:
Senkenoi Ene Letiti Oosingi is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children who are schooling. For twelve years Senkenoi has been farming on her own piece of land and making a good income.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area. This will be her 2nd loan which she is planning to spend to buy twelve bags of fertilizer and three bags of wheat remains to prepare wheat seeds for the next planting season. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Senkenoi's dream is to educate her kids to university level and to expand her farming. She is a persevering woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy twelve bags of fertilizer and three bags of wheat remains for seeds

loans.name: Tukhtasun

texts.en:
Tukhtasun is a young married man. He has owned a small grocery store in Dushanbe, Tajikistan for 5 years. His experience helps him run this business well. The store is open 24 hours a day and offers all kinds of food to its customers. Tukhtasun offers only good and fresh products and is always looking for more ways to improve client service. Tukhtasun would like to borrow 7,000 TJS to increase his assortment of products. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar K. is married and has three children. She runs a small business selling clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She has a variety of clothing products at reasonable prices. Mutabar started her venture six years ago and has achieved stability since then. She has many customers who  buy clothing from her because they know she does not sell low quality merchandise in her kiosk. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Mutabar decided to expand her trade. Mutabar's determination and desire to provide only the best quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To Increase working capital of the clothing business

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
Marufjon is married with two children. He started his business selling general goods 10 years ago. Financial assistance from IMON International has helped Marufjon develop and expand his business. Marufjon is planning to use this loan of 7,000 TJS to purchase additional goods to expand his assortment. He believes a variety of merchandise will boost his sales and help him generate additional profit. Marufjon’s goal is to continue refining his business skills so that he can keep his venture growing and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: purchasing more goods to expand his assortment

loans.name: Sharofidin

texts.en:
Sharofidin is married with 4 children. He has been selling groceries in the local central market for 10 years. His merchandise is assorted and of very good quality. Sharofidin has promptly repaid his 5 previous loans. He is very disciplined, responsible and thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All of these qualities have helped Sharofidin overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to become successful in business. He has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. Sharofidin is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and bringing him profit.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 33 years old and married to K. Cherusei who is a matatu (minibus) driver, and he supports his family. Right now his monthly income is $15. Josphine also supports their family of eight people. She has been in the business of livestock keeping for five years.

She is borrowing 5,000 KES to purchase more goats to raise and sell. She plans to use the anticipated profit to educate her children. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She hopes to grow her business and in future be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Richard Masika

texts.en:
Richard Masika W. is a man of forty-two years, married and the father of six children. They live in Bondeni in Kitale town. He sells fruit in the same area and has been in this business for fourteen years now. He gets a monthly income of approximately $113.

This will be Richard's 4th loan with KADET LTD. He has successfully repaid the other three loans. With this loan he will buy twenty creates of mangoes worth 20,000 KES, fifteen stems of bananas worth 4,000 KES, two bags of oranges worth 4,000 KES and 1,000 pineapples worth 1,000 KES. 

With the anticipated profits he plans to pay school fees for his children. Richard plans to expand his business and also raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted fruits like mangoes, bananas, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en:
Baktygul S. is the mother of a young and very tight-knit family with three little daughters. Her husband works as an officer at the local administrative branch. To find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Baktygul decided to open a grocery store. She worked hard and managed to develop her business, which now has a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS.

In 2005, with the revenues from selling groceries, Baktygul and her husband started their cattle-breeding business. Presently, they don't have good conditions to maintain their livestock, so Baktygul plans to obtain a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase building materials to construct a barn for her cattle. In the future, she dreams of owning a big farm with a huge number of cattle.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a barn

loans.name: Yusuf Kea

texts.en:
Yusuf Kea O. is a 28-year-old man from Bakarani. He has been a greengrocery owner for the last eight years. This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase vegetables for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business. Yusuf’s hopes and dreams are to raise his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est commerçante.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 8 enfants entre 8 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née à Congo (DRC), mais maintenant elle habite à Nyabugogo à Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 sacs de pommes de terre et payement de transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et remboursement de prêts à temps pour être indépendante chez elle.  Elle voudrait avoir un dépôt de pommes de terre, et aussi diversifier les articles de son commerce.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Pauline N. is a merchant. She is 43 years old, she is a widow, and she has 8 children between the ages of 8 and 23. She has a primary school education and all of her children attend school. She was born in Congo (Democratic Republic of Congo), but she now lives in Nyagugogo in Rwanda. She will use her loan to purchase 50 sacks of potatoes and to pay for the transport. Her strategy for the growth of her business is to save money, to repay her loans on time, and to be independent.  She would like to become a supplier of potatoes, and to diversify the products she sells. In terms of her family, she would like to purchase a home for them.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sacks of potatoes and to pay for their transport.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy K. is 42 years old and lives in Bungoma town. She is married to Newton. They have three children who are age 15, 10 and 7 years old. 

Lucy has a beauty salon that she runs in the market and has seen her business grow through the years. This is her 13th year in business. She is in need of hair chemicals and hairpieces for plaiting her clients' hair. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. Her monthly income comes to about $200 which is mostly used to go back into her business.

Her desire is to open up another beauty salon in the neighboring town.

loans.use: Buy hair chemicals and hairpieces for plaiting.

loans.name: Elizabeth Ndunge

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old married to Martin who contributes to the family income. They have six children aged between 20 years and 14 years. she has been running her farm for a period of five years with an income of KES. 20,000 in a  month. 

This is her third loan from  KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. She wants to use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and a jembe (goblet). She hopes to grow various types of legumes and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and jembe

loans.name: Carof

texts.en:
Carof M. is 30 years old single man from Kakamega town. He is a capenter and has been doing this business for the past four years. He is currently applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the previous loans. He intends to use the money to buy more timber to add to his stock. Carof earns a monthly income of Kes 11,000.

His desire is to open up a timber yard wholesale in the future.

loans.use: Buy more timber to add to his stock

loans.name: Limainge Ole

texts.en:
Lamainge Ole N. is 40 years old. He is married and blessed with six children.Lamainge is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build  rental houses.Lamainge is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry W. is 37 years old from Kakamega area, married to Beatrice and they have two children who are all going to school.

Henry has a bicycle business that he runs in Shianda area in Kakamega town. He is in need of bicycle spare parts and this has made him to apply for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him add stock to his business. Henry earns a monthly income of KES. 12,500 and this goes into paying school fees for his two children and also catering for the family's daily needs.

His hope is to be able to own a wholesale shop for bicycle spares.

loans.use: Buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married and has 4 children. She has no formal education. Yaa has been selling palm oil and fish in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. She and her husband combine their money to take care of the children. These expenses include paying for school fees, books, uniforms and other learning materials. Together they also pay for household expenses and the family's general sustenance.

Yaa's loan will be used to buy larger quantities of palm oil to increase her profit and further the expansion of her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide her children with the opportunity to enjoy a good education. She would also like to reinvest some the money back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of palm oil

loans.name: Alice Akinyi

texts.en:
Alice Akinyi O. is 38 years old lives in Awendo which is in Migori county and is married to Serphan who is a mason. They have five children who are all in school.

Alice has a business of selling clothes in Awendo market and has been in this business for the past 20 years. She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, she has a good credit history with us. Alice plans to use the money to buy more clothes for sale. 

The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also to venture into poultry business. Her desire is to open up a boutique in the future where she can be able to sell different kinds of clothes.

loans.use: Buy clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Joseph Dopoi

texts.en:
Joseph Dopoi S. is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with three children.  For the last twenty five years Joseph has been farming on his piece of land and recieves good income.

He learned about KADET LTD through other group registered with KADET limited in his area of residence. This will be his third loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build a permanent house, also give good education to his children. S. is a conscientious man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ntepapa Ole

texts.en:
Ntepapa Ole R. is 35 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. Ntepapa is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses. Ntepapa is a precise man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kirotie Ole

texts.en:
Kirotie Ole K. is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. Kirotie is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twelve years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has good credit history with KADET, this is his third loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build  rental houses. Kirotie is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Genara; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera; la socia trabaja como comerciante desde el año 2006, ella vende en el mercado vino canchón  verduras y papas, la socia lleva a vender cada vez sus terrenos producen papa y verduras, ella también es agricultora y trabaja la tierra en la época de siembra y cosecha y durante los meses que madura el producto ella saca las hierbas malas para que dejen crecer el cultivo. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar abono para su sembrío de papas y verduras. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Genarais a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving Is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Genara is 36 years old and single.  She has been working as a saleswoman since 2006.  She sells vegetables and potatoes in Vino Canchón market.  She makes her sales every time she harvests potatoes and vegetables from her land.  Genara is also a farmer and she works her land during the sowing and harvest seasons and, during the months that her products are maturing, she weeds her land so that her crops can grow.

Genara is requesting this loan to buy manure for her potato and vegetable crops.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy manure for her potato and vegetable crops

loans.name: Rosmy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosmy; La socia tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera; la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual ella misma lo administra y ella desea también paralelamente a esta actividad estudiar una carrera técnica, para lo cual pedirá que las horas que ella estudia su mamá la remplace en su abarrotes, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su tienda, ella comprara con el crédito arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, entre otros productos básicos como leche, aceite. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y comprar productos básicos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosmy is a member of the "Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving Is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosmy is 24 years old and single.  She has a small grocery store which she runs herself and she would also like, in parallel with this business activity, to study for a technical degree.  She will ask her mom to replace her in the grocery store during the hours that she is studying.

Rosmy is requesting this loan to invest in her store.  She will use it to buy rice, sugar, noodles, flour and other basic products such as milk and oil.  She is requesting this loan to keep her store running and to buy basic products.

Rosmy is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her business running and to buy basic products

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Genoveva; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella también compra animales menores y los cría, una vez que alcanzan la madures los vende y a mayor precio, entonces ella considera que le renta la compra reproducción y futura venta de los animales, ella cría chanchos, aves de corral, cuyes; La socia desea el crédito para la compra de animales menores específicamente pollos y patos, para criarlos y engordarlos esperar a la reproducción y la venta, la socia tiene sus clientes fijos en este populoso distrito, ya que Tipón es considerado un lugar de esparcimiento y recreación y aquí se puede degustar de diferentes platos típicos en especial del famoso cuy en todas sus versiones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y aves de corral entre otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the "Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Genoveva is 36 years old and single.  She sells goods retail.  She also buys young animals and raises them.  Once they have matured, she sells them for a higher price  She considers that buying, reproducing and selling animals is profitable.  She raises pigs, poultry and guinea pigs.

Genoveva would like a loan so that she can buy animals, specifically chickens and ducks, to raise and fatten, wait for reproduction, and then sell.  She has regular customers in this densely-populated district since Tipon is considered a place for relaxation and recreation and here you can taste different traditional dishes such as the famous guinea pig in all its variations.

Genoveva is requesting this loan to buy chickens, poultry and other animals.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chickens, poultry and other animals

loans.name: Konichbek

texts.en:
Konichbek S. is a talented artist with some disabilities. He was born into a large family with seven children and from childhood was compelled to be healed because of poor health. Unfortunately, his sense of hearing seriously suffered and now he needs to use a hearing device. From early childhood, Konichbek had a propensity to fine arts and gave his first performance in 4th grade. After graduating from college, he became an artist and worked as a layout man.

In 1980, Konichbek got married and soon became a father of one son and one daughter. His marriage was very happy, but in 1997 tragedy shattered his life - his beloved wife died and he became a single parent, taking care of his children by himself. Despite his difficulties, Konichbek made every effort to provide his children with all they needed. In order to cover all of his family's expenses, he started to take on different orders, for decorations and interiors. Konichbek also takes part in regional exhibitions and trade fairs, where his work has become very popular and in great demand.

In order to broaden his activities, Konichbek took his first loan from Bai Tushum in order to purchase canvases, pigments and baguettes, which were used as intended and the loan was repaid. Now, Konichbek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy artistic materials (colours, canvases, etc), revenues of which will allow him to renovate his studio. In the future, Konichbek dreams of showing his paintings in international exhibitions under his motto: “Cooperation leads to the peace of the world”.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 22 años, vive en la compañía de su madre y hermanos en la casa de uno de sus familiares.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad a personas conocidas, también prepara  almuerzos que lleva a sus clientes. Su madre  es su principal socia en este negocio, trabaja todos los días distribuyendo sus horarios, entre sus estudios y su labor;  y es así que su negocio esta prosperando con éxito además obtiene regulares ganancias  que le permiten sostenerse económicamente por lo que para mas adelante desea instalar su  tienda de abarrotes y también quiere captar más clientes nuevos que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente segura de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, además  agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Erika tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más  mercadería en abarrotes  para seguir preparando sus comidas, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Erika is 22 years old.  She lives with her mother and siblings in a house belonging to a family member.

For four years, Erika has been selling essentials to her acquaintances.  She also prepares lunches that she delivers to customers.  Her mother is her main partner in this business.  She works every day, dividing her hours between her studies and her work.  In this way, her business is prospering and successful.  She also makes regular profits that allow her to support herself financially.  In the future, she would like to set up a grocery store and she would also like to attract more new customers which will allow her to increase her profits.

This is Erika's second loan with MFP.  She feels secure to know that she has financial support and has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Erika plans to invest her loan money in buying more merchandise (groceries) to continue making her meals.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy groceries to continue in her business

loans.name: Agusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Agusto; El socio tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente; el socio tiene 3 hijos, el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de autos, el socio compra con un capital que lo tiene trabajando durante años y compra autos de la frontera de segunda y los trae a su natal Tipon a vender a sus amigos y otros, el socio apoya a su conyugue en su restaurante los fines de semana y de este modo todo lo que ingresa se sigue ahorrando para poder dar la mejor educación a sus hijos, el socio desea el crédito para poder aumentar a su capital para la compra de otro vehículo que le pidieron y esta a puertas de viajar a la frontera entre Perú y Chile para traer el vehículo. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar a su capital y adquirir un auto para la venta.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Agusto is part of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON” communal bank, located in the Tipon district and within the province and department of Cusco.

Agusto is 49 years old, in a cohabiting relationship, and has three children.  He buys and sells cars at the border, with his own capital, and imports them to Tipon to sell to his friends and to others.

He helps his partner in her restaurant on the weekends and saves what he earns there, so that he will be able to provide for a good education for his children.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a car that was requested of him.  He is getting ready to travel to the Chile-Peru border to bring it.

He is grateful for this loan and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy a car for resale

loans.name: Licett

texts.es: Liccet, de 28 años, vive en una casa arrendada  en compañía de su madre; juntas buscan salir adelante en busca del progreso.Desde hace cuatro años vende libros que distribuye de casas editoriales de prestigio, vende principalmente a docentes, librerías  y también al público en general, es por eso que siempre esta en búsqueda de clientes.  Muestra su catalogo de libros a sus clientes lo que le permite ofrecer con garantía y buen precio ofertas de cada libro, se siente contenta y satisfecha de desarrollar este negocio porque ve que aparte de resultarle  rentable en sus ganancias  es un negocio positivo que aporta a la cultura de su comunidad . Como es una mujer emprendedora para el fututo tiene planeado  incrementar su capital y obtener un  lugar estable de ventas.Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Licett tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  libros de novedosas ediciones, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Liccet is 28 years old.  She lives in a rental house with her mother.  Together they look to get ahead in life, in search of progress.

For four years, Liccet has been selling books from prestigious publishing houses.  She mainly sells to teachers, bookstores, and also to the general public.  She is always looking for new customers.  She shows her book catalog to her customers which allows her to sell with a guarantee and to offer each book for a very good price.  She feels happy and satisfied to be in this business because she sees that, in addition to being profitable, it is also a positive business that brings culture to her community.  As Liccet is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to increase her capital and obtain a stable place from which she can make her sales.

This Is Liccet's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will make this loan possible since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Liccet plans to invest the money she has requested in buying a larger quantity of new edition books.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of books to stock her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa P. sells palm oil and fish at Abrafo near Abura. Adjoa has received junior high school education and is married with four children. Her husband is a forester. Adjoa has been selling palm oil and fish for three years. She is responsible for paying part of her children's school fees as well as books and other learning materials. She also contributes to her husband's housekeeping money. Her loan will be used to buy more baskets of palm fruits as required for producing the oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy greater amounts of fish so she can sell more. She will also reinvest some of the money into her palm oil business. Her greatest hope is to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of palm fruits for producing oil.

loans.name: Lushaufan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Lushaufon; El socio tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, el socio trabaja comprando y vendiendo autos en Oropesa a comisión, el socio tiene a su hermano mayor en este negocio y así como el socio entro en el negocio ahora el está apoyando a su hermano y el invertirá el crédito para aumentar al capital de su hermano y hacerse socios para comprar un vehículo y luego lo venderán y se repartirán las ganancias o de lo contrario volverán a  invertir en otro autos mas en sociedad y de este saldrá las ganancias para ambos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el aumento de capital para la compra de un vehículo y su futura venta.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lushaufon is a member of the "Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Lushaufon is 22 years old and single.  He works buying and selling cars, on commission, in Oropesa.  His older brother is also in this business.  He is supporting his brother in the business and will invest his loan in increasing his brother's capital and in them becoming partners in buying a vehicle which they will then sell and split the profits, or they will re-invest in other vehicles together and their profits will come from that.

Lushaufon is requesting this loan to invest in increasing capital so that he can buy a vehicle which he will then sell.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in increasing his capital so that he can buy a vehicle which he will later sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa Mannan is widow and has four children. She has received schooling through primary school. Yaa sells palm oil at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for the past five years. Yaa uses her income to pay for the necessaries of her family as well as her children's school fees. Yaa will use the loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit needed to prepare the oil she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to further expand her business in order to be able to take care of her children, especially of their education.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to prepare oil for resale.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa M. is a widow with eight children. She has received a primary school education. Yaa sells palm oil and local soap at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for four years. Yaa uses her income to support her dependents and pay school fees for her children who are still in school. Yaa will use the loan to purchase a larger quantity of palm oil in order to sell more. She will also buy more powder needed to prepare the soap she sells. Yaa plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business and to pay back the loan. Her hope is to make enough money to provide a solid education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of palm oil.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí, de 29 años, vive en casa de su madre con su hijo; juntos se esfuerzan todos los días para salir adelante.Desde hace 4 años, vende cosméticos y prendas de vestir, comercializa de manera ambulante a las personas que conoce y ofrece sus productos al crédito  para después cobrar de acuerdo al tiempo pactado entre sus clientes. La  venta de cosméticos le resulta muy beneficiosa y rentable porque recibe incentivos de la marca y además  puede ofrecer ofertas y promociones  para que sus clientes se mantengan fieles al consumo de sus productos, es por esta razón que desea incrementar su capital de trabajo en cosméticos y prendas de vestir.Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.Noemí tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mas mercadería, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Noemí is 29 years old.  She lives in her mother's house with her child.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

For four years, Noemí has been selling cosmetics and clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and sells to people that she knows.  She offers her products on credit and then collects payments in accordance with the terms she has agreed with her customers.  Her cosmetics sales are very profitable and useful to her because she receives incentives from the brand owners and she can provide her customers with offers and promotions so that they remain loyal to her products.  For this reason, she would like to increase her working capital for her cosmetics and clothes business.

This is Noemí's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Noemí is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Noemí plans to invest the money she has requested in buying more merchandise since she would like to be able to offer the very best to her customers.  in this way, she hopes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to improve her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa K. is divorced and has four children. She has no formal education. Yaa sells cooked rice at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for five years. Yaa uses her income to pay her children's school fees and take care of their well-being. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more rice in order to prepare more portions of cooked rice and serve more customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa will keep paying her children's school fees so they can enjoy the best education possible. She will also reinvest some of the money to keep her business growing.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to increase her production of food.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia E. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Efia sells palm oil at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a driver. Efia uses her income to pay for the needs of her family, together with her husband. She contributes to the paying of school fees, books and uniforms for their children who go to school. Efia will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits needed for the preparation of the oil she then sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia plans to increase the well-being of her family. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education. Furthermore, she will reinvest some of the money back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: For the last year, Adjoa A. has made a living selling clothing in the traditional way -- from a large bowl she carries on her head. She does her selling in the village of Abrafo, which is located near the larger town of Abura. She has received a junior high school education, is single, has one child, and is her small family's sole source of income. She is applying for this loan to buy a greater variety of clothing to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a good life for her child and herself, and to expand her small business.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the last six years, Ama Y. has made a living selling toiletries in the traditional way -- from a bowl she carries on top of her head. She lives in Abrafo, which is located near the larger town of Abura. She supplements her income by selling palm oil. Ama has received middle school education, is divorced and has six children. She is responsible all by herself for paying her children's school fees, and providing them with the materials they need to go to school. She will use her loan to boost her business by buying more goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her small business by buying more goods to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 28 years old, married and has two children who are six and eight years old. For the last year she has made a living by selling eggs, working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day. She has applied for this loan from Kiva and the Vision Finance Company to expand her business and acquire more customers. She plans to keep reinvesting in her business to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati F. is married and has four children. She received a primary school education and has, for the last eight years, made a living selling banku, a local dish which is made from fermented corn and cassava dough. She sells her banku with fish in the town of Abrafo, which is located near the larger town of Abura. Her husband makes a living as a farmer. Fati uses most of her income to pay for her children's school fees and school supplies. She has applied for this loan to expand her small business by buying more corn and cassava to make into banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more corn and cassava to make into banku, a local delicacy.

loans.name: Sosthene

texts.en: Sosthene is 29 years old, married and has three children. He and his family live in Muhura, which is near the town of Byumba, where he makes a living selling products such as rice, sorghum and beans. He has been in this line of work for four years, and runs his business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. weekdays. He has two employees working for him, and has applied for this loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying more products to sell. His goal is to increase his profits and begin selling a wider range of products in wholesale markets.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en:
Frederic is 60 years old. He is married with four children who are between 20 and 36 years old.

Frederic is commonly known in the business of rearing cows that, in turn, produce milk for sale. He has been in this business for about four years and operates his business every day.

Frederic has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase many cows so that he can increase the quantity of milk to be sold each day. With this increase in liters of milk to be sold, he hopes to earn more profits. These profits will allow him to start saving and creating some other sources of income, as well as creating many jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase many cows so that he can increase the quantity of milk to be sold each day

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells oil made from the kernels of the palm fruit in Abrafo near Abura. 

Adjoa has a junior high school education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a security officer. 

Adjoa has been selling palm-kernel oil for the past three years. She is responsible for paying for groceries and other utilities. She also supports her husband in paying the school fees for their children. 

Her loan will be used to buy a larger amount of the palm-fruit kernels needed to prepare the oil. Her hope is to create a larger and more consistent income. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to make sure her children receive the best education possible. She is also aiming for further expansion of her business and will therefore reinvest some of the money she makes back into it.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of the palm-fruit kernels needed to prepare the oil she makes

loans.name: Angeles Maravillosos Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Ángeles Maravillosos”, ya que para sus familias son como unos ángeles porque aunque tengan carencias luchan por salir adelante en sus vidas diarias y apoyar la superación D. sus hijos.
