Este grupo está ubicado en Pachuca Hidalgo. Ma. Antonieta Saldiva es la presidenta D. este grupo. Tiene 31 años estudio hasta el sexto año D. primaria. Es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. tamales desD. hace tres años. Solicita el préstamo para poder dar más variedad D. productos a sus clientes ya que gracias al préstamo no solo venD. tamales sino también pan y a su vez atole y café, esto con el propósito D. elevar mas sus ventas y poder otorgarles mejor servicio a sus clientes. Sus clientes nos comentan que la señora Ma. Antonieta tiene un sazón muy rico y que hace sus tamales picositos además que ellos nos dicen que como la señora habré desD. temprano les da la oportunidad D. desayunar con sus hijos antes D. llevarlos a la escuela, no solo eso ellos comentan que antes D. hacer sus labores diarias aprovechan 10 minutos para desayunar y no irse con el estomago vacio a sus trabajos. con el tiempo poder  adquirir un local  comercial y poder vivir decorosamente en su comunidad, así mismo generar progreso en su entorno y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y  darles ejemplo D. que se pueden hacer las cosas teniendo voluntad y una buena actitud en la  vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Ángeles Maravillosos” (Marvellous Angels) since, for their families, these ladies are like angels because although they lack things, they still work hard to get ahead in their daily lives and to support their children in improving themselves.

This group is located in Pachuca Hidalgo.  Maria Antonieta Saldiva is the group's president.  She is 31 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is a saleswoman and has three children.  For three years, her business has been selling tamales.  She is requesting this loan so that she can proviD. her customers with a wider variety of products since, thanks to her loan, she now sells not only tamales but also bread, 'atole' (a hot corn-based drink) and coffee.  This is all aimed at increasing her sales and providing a better service to her customers.  Her customers tell us that Maria Antonieta's food is very rich and that her tamales are very hot and spicy.  They also tell us that she opens very early in the morning so that they have the opportunity to have breakfast with their children before taking them to school.  They also tell us that before going to do their daily work, they put asiD. ten minutes to enjoy breakfast so that they don't arrive at work with an empty stomach.

Over time, Maria Antonieta would like to acquire commercial premises and be able to live a respectable life within her community.  She would also like to make progress in her environment, get her children ahead in life and set an example for them, showing them that they can accomplish things if they just have a will to do them and a good attituD. in life.

loans.use: To increase the variety of her products

loans.name: Rutigana

texts.en:
P. is 22 years old and single. P. is commonly known in the business of selling cows and he has been in this business for two years. He employs two people to help him. P. works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

P. has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to additional cows for sale. With these additional cows, P. will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business of selling cows. P. will also start saving for a better future and saving to build his house.

loans.use: Additional cows for sale

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé depuis 2 ans et demi lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 28 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Leur activité principale tourne autour du petit commerce 

Madame CODOU S. mise en médaillon sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est veuve et vit avec ses 07 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais et de sucre. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500.000 francs elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Depuis le décès de son mari, c'est avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise à partir de son petit commerce qu'elle entretien ses enfants en achetant à la fin de chaque mois de la nourriture, payer les factures d'électricité et d'eau etc.
texts.en:
The group named Bokk Jom was created 2 and a half years ago, at the same time when the communal bank to which they belong was created. It is made up of 28 women who live in the same quarter. Their principal activity is a small business. 

Mrs. Codou S., pictured above the crow, is the leader of the group. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and she lives with her 7 children. 

She has a business selling fresh and candied fish. She manages her business very well, following 5 years of experience. 

Her new loan is in the amount of 500.000 francs and she will increase the quantity of merchandise she purchases. 

Since the passing of her husband, the income generated from this small business has permitted her to support her children, purchasing every month their food and paying the water and hydro bills, etc.

loans.use: To purchase fresh and candied fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua M. is a married woman who has one child. She was educated through junior high school. She explains that her husband is a welder.

To earn a living, Akua sells bread. In addition, she operates a small business selling palm oil at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for two years. Akua uses her business income to pay a portion of her child's school fees. She also helps to pay for their family's daily living expenses. Akua is seeking a loan in the amount of $275 to purchase more raw materials to boost her bread-selling business. With the expected additional profits generated as a result of the loan and an expanded business, Akua plans to establish a small stall at the market. She is confident that she can increase her profits from her relatively new business venture.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 25 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive con su esposo Amancio y sus dos pequeños hijos  en su casa que es propia.Se  dedica a su pequeño negocio y al cultivo de cacao, café y coca. Todos los días, muy temprano, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en la ciudad de San Francisco y lo realiza  en su propio negocio, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, ya lleva cinco años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos las enfermen. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y obtener más mercadería de abarrotes, para tener mejores ingresos.Este es su primer préstamo de Juana con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su negocio, y en  su banco comunal es muy querida porque siempre mantiene su carisma y buen humor.Juana tiene planeado invertir los mil  soles solicitados en la  compra de  mercadería de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio, ya que desea tener otro ingreso por ese medio, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Juana is 25 years old and is a simple, yet hard working woman.  She lives with her husband and two small children in their own home, and has a small business where she raises cacao, coffee, and coca.  Each day she begins working on her crops early in the morning, because she knows that the money she earns depends on the quality of her harvest.

She sells her products in the city of San Francisco, as part of her business, because receives the best prices there.  What she enjoys most is harvesting on her own land because it makes her feel that the months of work have been fruitful.  She’s been doing this for five years and feels that the most difficult part is fumigating her farmland, because there is always a risk that the chemicals will make her sick.  She hopes to improve her crops in the future and increase the amount of food she produces, so that she can increase her income.

This will be Juana’s first loan through MFP and she tells us that the money will greatly help her in her business.  She is well liked in her communal bank because she always maintains her charisma and good mood.  Juana will use the money to buy grocery items with which to stock her business because she wants to add another source of income.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Efia

texts.en:
Efia Yaa A. is a married woman. She and her husband do not have any children. She was educated through senior high school. She explains that her husband is an electrician.

To earn a living, for the past three years Efia Yaa has been selling cooked rice at a wooden stand on the road side at Abrafo near Abura. Efia Yaa uses her business income to pay a portion of her family's utility expenses and home maintenance costs. Efia Yaa is seeking a loan in the amount of $275 to purchase additional bags of rice and to thereby satisfy customer demand for her rice. With the increase in profits she expects she'll be able to generate as a result of the loan and from an expanded business, Efia Yaa plans to save some money and to reinvest some money back into her business.

loans.use: To meet customer demand and expand her business by purchasing additional rice

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino, de 38 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, está casado con Rómula, de 38 años, y viven en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El trabajo al que Albino se dedica es el cultivo de café, cacao y hoja coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la cosecha, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido frutos. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde su chacra hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Albino, 38, is a very happy and hardworking man.  He's married to Rómula, 38, and they live in their own house with their three children who are the prime reason for all their efforts.

Albino cultivates coffee, cacao, and coca leaves.  Early every morning he goes to work his fields because he knows the money he makes for his products depends on the quality of the harvest.  He sells in the city of San Francisco because that's where the prices are best.

What Albino likes most about his work is the harvest, because it makes him feel like all those months of labor have born fruit.  He's been doing this for eight years and considers the hardest part to be transporting the products from the farm to the drying area.  Later on he would like to obtain more fields to increase production.

This will be Albino's third loan with MFP and he feels like the money will really help him take his business forward.  He is very well-loved by the other members of his village bank because he is very tight with them.  He plans to use the 1000 soles he is seeking to buy more fertilizers to improve the quality of his fields.

loans.use: Compra de abono y fertilizantes

loans.name: Twitezimbere Cb Group

texts.en:
Marie Josee is the group leader of this borrowing group called Twitezimbere in Kinyarwanda, which means "let us develop” in English. She is a 49-year-old widow with two children, who are twelve and sixteen years old. Both of her children currently attend school.

To earn a living, for the past four years, Marie Josee has been selling green bananas. Marie Josee says that her business has been successful because she resolved certain serious family issues. She is thankful for the popularity of her business.

Marie Josee explains that her borrowing group's members are well organized and are determined to make positive changes to their businesses. The group members sell different products. To improve their various businesses, they decided to request a group loan. Marie Josee intends to use her portion of the group loan to purchase more green bananas for re-sale purposes. She plans to use any additional profits generated as a result of the loan to pay for her children's school fees and to provide food for her family. She dreams of operating a small supermarket in the future.

In the picture, Marie Josee is sitting in front, with money in one hand and a black handbag on her left side. The other people in the picture, including the men in the back row, are family friends of the borrowers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional green bananas

loans.name: Fuerza Femenina Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama “Fuerza Femenina”, el nombre se escogió porque el grupo está integrado por mujeres emprendedoras y con ilusiones de progresar, se encuentra ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo y está conformado por 10 integrantes. S. C. es presidenta del grupo, tiene 28 años, es casada, cuenta con estudios de secundaria y tiene  3 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de blancos, tiene 5 años con este negocio y solicita el préstamo para poder surtir más su negocio y así poder tener mayor variedad para acreditarlo y con esto elevar sus ventas. Sus clientes nos  comentan que la Señora Jeniffer es una excelente vendedora, es una mujer trabajadora, amable, de excelente carácter.Quiere este crédito para aumentar la variedad de sus colchas, sábanas, cobertores, y espera que con este crecimiento aumenten sus ventas y así poder  rentar un local comercial para tener un mejor desarrollo y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia para poder vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en: The group is called "Fuerza Femenina" which translates to "Feminine Force". This name was chosen because the group is made up of enterprising women with dreams of progress. The group is located in the state of Hidalgo and is made up of 10 members. S. C. is president of the group. She is 28 years old, is married and finished high school. She has three children. She has been selling linens for five years and she is requesting this loan to better stock her business so that she can have more variety of products to offer by credit so that she can increase her sales. Her clients tell us that Jeniffer is an excellent saleswoman. She is hardworking, friendly and has excellent character. She is requesting this loan to increase the variety of her bed covers, sheets and blankets. She hopes that with this increase will be able to increase her sales so that she can rent a commercial space so that her business can develop. This will allow her to provide for her family's needs so that she can live peacefully.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of bed covers, sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N. is a divorced woman who was not formally educated and who does not have any children. To earn a living, Abena sells kenkey, which is a local dish made from fermented corn dough. She also runs a drinking bar at Abrafo near Abura, which she has operated for the past four years. Abena uses her business income to pay for the operating costs of her bar as well as for her home maintenance costs.

Abena is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 to purchase more ingredients needed for the preparation of the kenkey she sells to her customers. With the increase in profits she expects as a result of the loan and from an expanded business, Abena plans to further expand her rather new kenkey business and to establish it in the Abrafo market.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional ingredients for kenkey

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Francisco y sus seis jóvenes  hijos.Desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo necesario  para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucha  paciencia. Ella siembra cacao, café y coca, las cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, ya lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción.Es su  décimo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, además en  su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y participe.Julia tiene planeado invertir  los tres mil soles solicitados en la compra de  abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Julia, age 38, is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house she owns with her husband, Francisco, and their six young children. As a small child Julia worked on the farm with her parents, who taught her everything she needed to know in order to raise good crops. She now has her own land, which she farms and takes care of patiently.

Julia grows cacao, coffee, and coca, which she sells in San Francisco city. What Julia likes best about her work is the harvest, when all of her hard work starts to pay off. She has been farming for 18 years, and thinks the most difficult part of the work is keeping her crops free from pests and disease. Her hope is to buy new land to increase her production. 

This is Julia's tenth loan with MFP. She knows she has to make her loan payments on time and is willing to do so. She is a cheerful and involved member of her community bank. Julia plans to invest the 3,000 PEN loan in the purchase of fertilizer for her farm so that she can obtain a good yield this season.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to improve crops.

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene C. M. tiene 29 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Mercy Marlene se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien

Le gusta conversar con sus amigos
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene C. M. is 29 years old and lives with her partner in the neighborhood of Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. She has two children.

The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra (Our Land) meet in the building of San Luís de Zapotal in Ventanas. This group of 14 works in agriculture with fast-growing crops such as corn and rice.

Mercy Marlene works farming corn, cocoa, soy, and rice. She buys her products at Farma-Agro and sells them in the same place. She is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice, to buy fertilizer and seeds. This loan will help support her economically by supplying for her needs. She faces challenges such as plagues and illness and the changing climate. Her dream is that her children may study. She enjoys talking with her friends.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a married woman with two children. Gladys was educated through the middle school. Her husband is a farmer.

For the past four years, to earn a living, Gladys has been selling provisions at a roadside wooden stand at Abrafo near Abura. With her business income she is able to pay for her family's daily living expenses. For example, she uses her income to purchase groceries, pay electricity bills, and cover her children's school fees. She explains that she is very proud to be able to contribute to their household income so that they have a decent standard of living.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $275 to buy inventory for her shop in order to meet customer demand. She plans on using the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to offer her customers a larger variety of goods and to thereby attract more customers. In this way, she hopes to invest most of the profits generated by the loan back into her business.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand and to attract more customers by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGUEYE est créé depuis 2 ans et depuis. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont de quartiers différents mais regroupe par le Banc Villageois de CITE LAMY. 

Madame MAGUETTE M. à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle est commerçante, elle vend des marchandises diverses telles des tissus des vaisselles et des jus de fruits.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter de la marchandise pour un montant de 300.000 francs CFA et les 100.000 autres milles francs seront destinés a la fabrique des jus de fruits.


Ses bénéfices lui permettrons de prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Ligueye was set up 2 years ago. It is made up of 13 women who come from different neighborhoods but who have been brought together by the City Lamy  Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Maguette M., at the far right of the photo, waving, is the group's leader. She is a widow, and the mother of 5 dependent children. She is a retailer, selling various products such as fabric, kitchen wares and fruit juice. With her new loan, she will buy merchandise for a total of 300,000 CFA francs and the remaining 100,000 CFA francs will be used to make fruit juice. With the profit, she will be able to pay for food, healthcare and schooling for her children.

loans.use: Develop and promote a revenue-producing business

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, de 42 años, está casado con Fortunata, de 40 años, y tienen 5 hijos; juntos habitan en su casa propia en el distrito de Samugari, perteneciente a la selva Ayacuchana.

Benito cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en los trabajos del campo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Actualmente viene sembrando cacao, café, coca plátano,  achiote y palillo; ya que estos son los productos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que puedan afectarlos, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy contento.
Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono, insecticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
Benito, 42 years old, is married to Fortunata, 40 years old, and they have 5 children. They live together in their own house in the district of Samugari belonging to the Ayacuchana forest.

Benito counts on the support of his wife in their work in the countryside. With a lot of effort he has managed to make his land very productive and now plants a little of everything because he knows that whatever produce he obtains will be of good quality. These days he has been planting cocoa, coffee, coca, banana, achiote, and palillo as these are the most in-demand products in the market.

What he most likes about his work is protecting his sown fields from the pests that could affect them and greatly reduce his earnings. He has been carrying out this activity for 9 years and considers the most difficult to be transporting his crops to the city of San Francisco, since it's there where he sells his produce. For the future of his business he hopes to collect the money necessary to buy new land.

This is the 16th loan that he has had from MFP and knows that this loan will help him a lot in the development of his activities. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is very happy about it. The two thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in improving his crops, for which he will buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Olga Natividad

texts.es:
Olga Natividad M. B. tiene 41 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Tiene 3 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Olga Natividad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta ver television
texts.en:
Olga Natividad M. B., aged 41, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has three children.

The members of the rural communal bank Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 14 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Olga Natividad is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies in Ecua-Agro and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to have her own farm. She likes watching television.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high school education. Ama has been selling palm oil, which she produces herself from palm fruits, in Abrafo, near Abura, for the past year. Her husband is a mechanic. Ama is responsible for paying part of the cost of her children's school fees and books. She also supports her husband in taking care of the family's financial affairs.

Ama's loan will be used to purchase more bags of palm fruits in order to produce more palm oil. Her hope is to gain more customers when she offers larger quantities of oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to sell her goods on a more regular basis and to be better prepared for possible unpredictable events.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of palm fruits to produce palm oil

loans.name: Willian Wilfrido

texts.es:
Willian Wilfrido V. V., tiene 28 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Willian Wilfrido se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Comercial Carlitos y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Willian Wilfrido V. V., aged 28, is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.

The members of the rural communal bank Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 14 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Willian Wilfrido is a farmer. He grows corn and rice. He buys his agricultural supplies at the market Comercial Carlitos and sells his products at the same place.

He applies for a loan to finance his sowing of corn and rice. He needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is to buy a house and a plot of land. He likes spending his free time with his family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 46 años, es viuda, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 6 queridos hijos.
Los verdes campos del poblado del distrito de Samugari, ubicado en la selva ayacuchana, han sido, en la vida de Faustina, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar y vivir, pues desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a labrar la tierra. Con el apoyo de su esposo, ahora fallecido, compraron sus propias tierras donde sembraron hoja de coca, café y cacao. Pero desde que su amado esposo falleció, ella se ha convertido en el pilar de su casa y clave en el destino de sus hijos, es por ello que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo frutos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde vende, además el servicio de transporte de sus productos es muy caro. Con el tiempo, Faustina espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es el 15avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan sus compañeros para el bienestar común.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas para su parcela.
texts.en:
Faustina is 46 years old, widowed and lives in her own home with her 6 dear children. The green fields of one village of Samugari, located in the Ayacuchana jungle, have been, for Faustina, a very pleasant place to work and live. With the support of her husband, now deceased, they bought their own land to plant coca, coffee and cocoa.  But since her beloved husband died, she has become the pillar of the house key to the fate of their children, which is why she works with great dedication and sacrifice. 

What she likes best about her job is to harvest the land, since she feels this arduous work is the fruits of her labor.  She has been doing this for 20 years and the hardest part is transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco, where she sells. Also, it is very expensive to transport her products. In time, Faustina is counting on making enough money to buy new land. 
 
This is her 15th loan from MFP and she knows that she is responsible for paying all of her dues on time and is willing to do so. In the community bank she is always aware that the agreements between her and her peers are for the common good.  With the money requested she will buy seeds for her land.

loans.use: Buying seeds

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alejandro (49)  y sus cuatro pequeños hijos.Todos los días muy temprano Juliana abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya  lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es no poder compartir muchos  momentos familiares en su hogar, por falta de tiempo. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, de esta manera espera  vender más productos.Este es el octavo préstamo de Juliana con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta.Juliana tiene planeado invertir  los tres mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Juliana is 39 years old and the mother of a very hardworking and loving family.  She lives in her own house with her husband Alejandro (49) and their 4 small children. Very early every morning Juliana opens her grocery store to tend to her neighbors.  She is a very skilled saleswoman, she knows how to treat her clients and always ends up convincing them to buy something more. Her shop is well stocked and she is always concerned about buying products that are needed. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  She has spent 10 years doing this and believes that the hardest part is not sharing many family moments at home, for lack of time. In the future, she hopes to expand her store and sell more products. This is her 8th loan from MFP and Juliana expects to be very punctual in her payments because she does not want to cause problems in her community bank, in which is is very happy. Juliana plans to invest the money in buying products to better implement her grocery store and expects to continue progressing.

loans.use: Buy groceries to implement her store

loans.name: Gbomuma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Gbomuma” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenenma, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama C.. Mariama, 28 years old, was born in Bonthe but she is currently residing in Kenema together with her husband and three children, who attend primary school. Mariama has been selling firewood, peppers, cooking oil, fish, onions, etc. for 6 years. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items in wholesale quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy peppers, cooking oil, fish, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Daniel Alexis

texts.es:
Daniel Alexis V. V. tiene 39 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Daniel Alexis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijas estudien.

Le gusta estar con su familia
texts.en:
Daniel Alexis V. V., aged 39, is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.

The members of the rural communal bank Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 14 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Daniel Alexis is a farmer. He grows corn and rice. He buys his agricultural supplies at the market Ecua-Agro and sells his products at the same place.

He applies for a loan to finance his sowing of corn and rice. He needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is that his daughters may study. He likes spending his free time with his family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 36 años, es un hombre muy divertido y trabajador, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa Margarita, de 34 años, y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

La bodega de Félix es la primera en abrir en el poblado de Kimbiri, desde las 5 de la mañana su negocio está listo para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta a Félix de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder realizar otras actividades.
Cabe mencionar que tiene un carro, el cual alquila para el servicio de taxi, lo que le da la oportunidad de tener un ingreso extra y ofrecer trabajo a otra persona. Con el tiempo, anhela poder tener otro negocio, con el cual mejore la economía de su familia.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Félix con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere tener problemas con su banco comunal, donde es muy respetado.
Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará repuestos para su carro y más abarrotes para surtir su variada tienda y así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felix is 36 years old. He is a very hardworking and fun guy. He lives in his own house with is wife, Margarita (34) and his 5 dear children for whom he wants to provide a better life. 

Felix's shop is the first to open in the town of Kimbiri.  At 5 in the morning his business is ready to receive early bird buyers, who knowing the variety of goods he has in his store do not hesitate to buy, and they are assured that they will find things that they need.

What Felix likes most about his job is talking with customers and learning about things that happen in his neighborhood. He has been in this business for 10 years and believes that the hardest thing is to stay inside his shop all day, unable to do other activities.

It is worth mentioning that he has a car, which he rents for a taxi service. This gives him the opportunity for extra income and offers employment to others. Over time, he wants to have another business, which will improve his family finances.

This is Felix's third loan from MFP and he expects to pay on time, so that he will not have problems in his community bank, where he is very respected. With the money he is requesting, he will buy parts for his car and more groceries to stock his shop to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Carlos Plutarco

texts.es:
Carlos Plutarco V. V. tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre, con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Carlos Plutarco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Comercial Carlitos y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Carlos Plutarco V. V., aged 32, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.

The members of the rural communal bank Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 14 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Carlos Plutarco is a farmer. He grows corn and rice. He buys his agricultural supplies at the market Comercial Carlitos and sells his products at the same place.

He applies for a loan to finance his sowing of corn and rice. He needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is to buy a farm. He likes playing soccer.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Karem Lisbeth

texts.es:
Karem Lisbeth G. C. tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  No Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Le gusta hacer ejercicios
texts.en:
Karem Lisbeth G. C. is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the Ventanas district of Los Ríos province.  She is single and doesn't have any children.

The members of Tierra Nuestra V.R.C. (rural loan group) are located in San Luís de Zapotal, an area in Ventanas. The group consists of 14 members who farm maize and rice during the short planting season. 

Karem is a farmer and plants maize and rice. She buys inputs from Ecua-Agro and sells her harvest there as well. She is requesting this loan to buy seed and supplies. The income generated through this loan will help her cover her basic expenses. Karem struggles with pests, crop diseases, and the unpredictable weather. Karem enjoys exercise and her dream is to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and supplies.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 30 años, es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, vive junto a su pareja con el que tienen 4 hijos. La casa que habitan es propia y está ubicada en el distrito de Samugari, selva de Ayacucho.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas; cultiva cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que invierte todas sus fuerzas para sacar adelante este negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos,  pero cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja, quien es su brazo derecho. Para más adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anterior crédito y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 30 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working person who lives together with her partner and their four children.  She lives in her own home which is located in Samugari district, in the jungle of Ayacucho.

Through a lot of hard work, Florencia has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf and then takes these products to the city of San Francisco to sell wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself and help with her family's expenses.  For this reason, she invests all her effort into her business in order to make progress in it.

What Florencia most likes about her work is caring for her crops since she feels very happy doing it.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products.  However, she has the unconditional support of her partner who is her right-hand man.  In the future, she would like to buy new land so that she can increase her crops.

This is Florencia's third loan with MFP.  She was very punctual in paying back her previous loan and she hopes to continue to be punctual in paying back this loan too.  Florencia plays an active role in her community bank and she is always up to date on the agreements that have been reached within the group.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS ESTRELLAS DE GUADALUPE, en honor a la Virgen de Guadalupe quien es patrona de la región. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo,México. Está conformado por once integrantes.La señora Amalia C. es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es comerciante. En  total tiene tres hijos; de 13, 10 y 6 años.  La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos de cerámica como utensilios de cocina, adornos de temporada, entre otros. Solicita el crédito para invertir en cerámica, pues quiere ampliar su negocio, obtener mayores ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.La foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Rosa Bautista quien ofreció su domicilio para la reunión del grupo. En la foto se observa una armonía y un ambiente agradable que muestra el compañerismo y la unión que hay entre cada una de las integrantes del grupo comunal. La sra. Claudia no salió en la foto debido a que fue la pastorela de su hijo donde debía estar presente.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Estrellas de Guadalupe ("The Stars of Guadalupe"), in honor of Our Lady of Guadalupe, the patron saint of the region. The group has 11 members; they live in the State of Hidalgo in Mexico.

Señora Amalia C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 38 years old, studied until the third grade in secondary school and is a merchant. She has three children, aged 13, 10 and 6. Amalia sells pieces of pottery, such as kitchenware and seasonal ornaments, among others. She applies for a loan to invest in pottery, because she wants to expand her business, have a higher income and provide her children with education.

The photo was taken at the house of Señora Rosa Bautista who graciously offered her home for the group meeting. You can see the harmony and the friendly atmosphere that show the camaraderie and the bonds between each of the members of the communal group.

Señora Claudia is not pictured because her son took part in a Nativity play and she had to be there.

loans.use: To buy pieces of pottery

loans.name: Nila Abigail

texts.es:
Nila Abigail V. M. tiene 52 años, es casada, vive con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Nila Abigail se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta conversar con sus amigas y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nila Abigail V. M. is 52 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas canton,  Los Ríos province. She has 5 children.  

The members of the rural bank TIERRA NUESTRA live in the San Luís de Zapotal community, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank has 14 members who work in short cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.  

Nila Abigail works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys her materials in Farma-Agro and sells in the same place. 

She is asking for the loan to buy materials and seeds to plant corn and rice. The support from the loan will help her to meet her needs financially and face challenges such as pests and disease and changes in the weather. Her dream is to have a farm.    

She likes to talk to her friends and play sports.

loans.use: To buy materials and seeds

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.es:
Gilberta tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de una hija llamada Elma, de 12 años, juntas viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Samugari, selva de Ayacucho.

Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Gilberta, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida y la de su pequeña hija. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hoja de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y cuenta con el apoyo de sus jornaleros, ella considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde los vende, ya que los sacos donde lleva los productos son muy pesados, es por ello tiene que pagar para transportarlos. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios.

Este es el 11avo préstamo de Gilberta con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable.
Los mil nuevos soles solicitados le servirán para pagar a los jornaleros, pues gracias al apoyo de ellos sus productos marchan muy bien.
texts.en:
Gilberta is 46 years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter called Elma who is 12 years old.  They live together in their own home which is located in Samugari district, in the jungle of Ayacucho.

The products that Gilberta has managed to grow through so much hard work and commitment have helped her a lot in making progress in her own life and her young daughter's life.  Every morning she goes out to work her land since she knows that the quality of her cacao, coffee and coca leaf crops depends on the care she takes of them.

What Gilberta most likes about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them grow large and plentiful.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she has the support of some laborers.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be taking her harvested crops to the city of San Francisco to sell since the sacks are very heavy.  For this reason, she has to pay for somebody to transport them.  In the future, Gilberta hopes to improve her produce so that she can obtain better prices.

This is Gilberta's 11th loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this.  Gilberta is a very supportive and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to pay her laborers since, thanks to their support, her crops are doing well.

loans.use: To pay her laborers

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda, de 46 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a su conviviente Máximo (47) y sus  tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El cultivo de cacao es la actividad que realiza diariamente ella, y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, pues  los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos.Este es el catorceavo préstamo de Leonarda con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta pues todos sus integrantes son muy responsables.Leonarda tiene planeado invertir los  tres mil soles solicitados en la compra de semillas, abono y fertilizantes, ya que desea mejorar su producción, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 46 years old.  She is a very loving and hard-working mother who lives in a rental house together with her partner Máximo (47) and her three young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Leonarda's daily activity is growing cacao.  Through a lot of hard work, she has managed to make her land very productive which means that her crops are very good quality and very highly prized in the city of San Francisco where she takes them to sell.

What Leonarda most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in this business for 25 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products since the sacks are very heavy and make her very tired.  In the future, she would like to buy new land which will allow her to increase her crop production.

This is Leonarda's 14th loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual in making her repayments as she doesn't want to cause problems for her community bank where she feels very happy because all the members are very responsible people.  Leonarda will invest the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in buying seed, manure and fertilizers since she would like to improve her production.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Klever Antonio

texts.es:
Klever Antonio G. V. tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ser Ingeniero Agroindustrial.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Klever Antonio G. V. is 25. He is single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has no children. 
The members of the V. R. C. Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") are located in the San Luis de Zapotal region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice. 
Klever Antonio works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in Ecua-Agro and sells them in the same location. 
He is requesting this loan for sowing corn, rice, and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to be an Agroindustrial engineer. 
He enjoys sports.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es:
Heraclio tiene 44  años, está separado de su pareja, pero a su responsabilidad están sus 5 hijos. Él cuenta con una casa que es propia y lo que más desea es poderles brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, para ello está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro.

Heraclio trata de sobresalir y sentirse un triunfador, junto a sus hijos mayores, labra la tierra donde tiene los siguientes sembríos: cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que posteriormente, después de la cosecha, llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, puesto que esto puede afectar sus ganancias. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar de su venta, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera juntar más dinero para comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP y sabe que le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo y responsable.
Con los 3000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para mejorar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Heraclio is 44 years old.  He is separated from his partner but has responsibility for his five children.  Heraclio owns his own home and what he wants more than anything is to be able to provide his children with a better quality of life.  For this, he is prepared to work very hard.  Heraclio tries to improve himself and feel like a winner.  Together with his older children, he works his land where he grows the following crops: cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  After harvesting, he takes his crops to sell in the city of San Francisco as this is where he obtains his best prices.

What Heraclio most likes about his work is protecting his crops from pests since this can affect his profits.  He has been in this business for 30 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops to sell since the sacks are very heavy.  In the future, he hopes to gather together more money to buy new land.

This is Heraclio's 13th loan with MFP and he knows that it will be very beneficial to his growth as a farmer.  Heraclio takes an active role in his community bank and he is a very responsible member.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure, to improve his plantations.

loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca M. M. tiene 57 años, es soltera, vive sola en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija que hace mucho tiempo se fue a España a buscar trabajo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Maria Francisca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que su hija regrese del extranjero.

Le gusta ver televisión y caminar.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca M. M. is 57 and single. She lives alone in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has one daughter who went to Spain in search of work a long time ago.

The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra ["Our Land"] are located in the San Luis de Zapotal area, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice.
Maria Francisca works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She purchases her products in Farma-Agro and sells them in the same location.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and rice, and to purchase supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is for her daughter to return from abroad.

She enjoys watching television and walking.

loans.use: The purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata tiene 23 años y es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Richard, de 25 años, y su querida hija Samerli de 4 años, por quien trabaja para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, Honorata sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son el cacao, el café y la hoja de coca, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de San Francisco.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas, además cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Para el futuro planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Honorata con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más semillas, también comprará abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Honorata is 23 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 25 year-old Richard, and her beloved daughter, 4 year-old Samerli, for whom she works so that she can provide her with a better quality of life.

Every day, very early in the morning, Honorata goes out to work in her fields.  There are no rest days for her since she has to work continually in order to ensure a good production.  Her main crops are cacao, coffee and coca leaf which she sells wholesale in the city of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is the freedom that she has working on her crops since she is free to enjoy her green fields.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be protecting her crops from the pests that can ravage them.  She has her partner's support.  In the future, Honorata plans to buy new land so that she can increase her crops.

This is Honorata's eighth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and she hopes to continue being punctual in making her new repayments.  Honorata is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very happy.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more seeds.  She will also buy manure and insecticides to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and insecticides

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo G. B. tiene 54 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es sembrar cacao

Le gusta conversar con sus amigos
texts.en:
Oswaldo G. B., 54, lives with his wife in Ventanas, a sub-region of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  He has 3 children.

The TIERRA NUESTRA community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, a town in Ventanas.  The bank has 14 members, all of whom operate farming businesses, growing maize and rice among other crops.  

Oswaldo grows maize, cacao, soybeans and rice.  He buys the supplies that he needs from Ecua-Agro and sells his crops there, too.  

Oswaldo is applying for a loan to buy supplies for his next crop: maize and rice seeds, for example.  The loan can help him buy the supplies he needs.  The challenges that he faces include insects, plant disease and weather.  He wants to plant cacao.

Oswaldo likes chatting with his friends.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Muloma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Muloma” group, comprised of small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu M.. Kadiatu, who is 35, was born in Kenema where she is currently residing with her husband and three children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are no longer attending school. For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling market-food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, rice, fish, onions, palm-oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these provisions at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy margi, salt, rice, fish, onions, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Elvis Alexis

texts.es:
Elvis Alexis G. G. tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Elvis Alexis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ser Ingeniero Agroindustrial.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte.
texts.en:
Elvis Alexis G. G., 20, is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a sub-region of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.

The TIERRA NUESTRA community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, a town in Ventanas.  The bank has 14 members, all of whom operate farming businesses, growing maize and rice among other crops.  

Elvis Alexis grows maize, soybeans and rice.  He buys the supplies that he needs from Farma-Agro and sells his crops there, too.  

Elvis Alexis is applying for a loan to buy supplies for his next crop: maize and rice seeds, for example.  The loan can help him buy the supplies he needs.  The challenges that he faces include insects, plant disease and weather.  He wants to be an agronomist.

Elvis Alexis enjoys sports.

loans.use: compra de insumos y semillas

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 29 años, es una mujer muy carismática y hacendosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Edwin, de 27 años y su querida hija Ariana, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Desde muy joven a Jessica le nació el gusto por las prendas de vestir, es por eso que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa. Actualmente realiza una ardua labor semanal, pues lleva las prendas hasta el domicilio de sus clientes, ya que, según manifiesta, así obtiene mayores ganancias. Jessica misma se encarga de comprar y transportar la ropa desde la ciudad de Lima (aproximadamente a 20 horas por tierra), por otro lado también vende cosméticos por catálogo y tiene un pequeño bar. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda en la capital, ya que así siente que se gana la confianza de sus compradores. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos de ropa, pero aun así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda en la ciudad de San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Jessica con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante.
Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima y algunas bebidas para su bar.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old.  She is a very charismatic and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 27 year-old Edwin, and her beloved daughter Ariana who is the motivation behind all her hard work.  

Jessica became interested in clothes when she was very young.  For this reason, she decided to sell clothes for a living.  She currently works a hard work week, delivering her clothes to her customers' homes since she tells us that in this way she makes more profits.  Jessica herself buys and transports the clothes from the city of Lima (approximately 20 hours away by land).  She also sells cosmetics through a catalog and runs a small bar.

What Jessica most likes about her work is advising her customers about the clothes that are in fashion in the capital since she feels that this helps her gain the trust of her buyers.  She has been in this business for 3 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting the heavy bundles of clothes.  However, even so, she does not give up since she knows that her family's well-being depends on her business.  Over time, she would like to be able to set up a store in the city of San Francisco in which she could provide a better service to her customers.

This is Jessica's third loan with MFP and she is ready to make her loan repayments on time since she would like to access new loans in the future.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes in the city of Lima and also some drinks for her bar.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena del Carmen M. M. tiene 60 años, es viuda, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Magdalena del Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un carro.

Le gusta sembrar plantas.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen M. M. is 60. She is a widow and lives in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has no children.
The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra ["Our Land"] are located in the San Luis de Zapotal region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice. 
Magdalena del Carmen works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, soy and rice. She purchases her products in Ecua-Agro and sells them in the same location. 
She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and rice, and for buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to have a car.
She enjoys planting plants.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora, de 26 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto  a su conviviente Leonardo (28)  y sus dos pequeños  hijos quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Todos los días muy temprano ella  abre su negocio de venta de zapatos para atender a sus clientes, es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su negocio esta muy bien surtido, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar lo que se encuentra a la moda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, ya lleva cuatro  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día en su negocio, sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, para poder vender más zapatos, de esta manera espera salir adelante.Este es el primer préstamo de Leonora con MFP, esta dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable.Leonora tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de  más zapatos para implementar mejor su negocio de zapatería.
texts.en:
Leonora is 26 years old.  She is a very modest and happy woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 28 year-old Leonardo, and her two young children who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

Every day, very early in the morning, Leonora opens up her shoe sales business to serve her customers.  She is a very skilful saleswoman.  She knows how to treat her customers and she always ends up convincing them to buy something extra.  Her business is very well stocked since she always makes sure that she buys whatever is in fashion.

What Leonora most likes about her work is chatting to her customers and finding out what is going on in her village.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the hardest part of her work to be the fact that she must remain in her business all day without being able to go out.  In the future, she hopes to extend her business premises so that she can sell more shoes.  In this way, she hopes to get ahead.

This is Leonora's first loan with MFP.  She is ready to save a little every day so that she can repay her loan completely.  Leonora is a very responsible member of her community bank.  She plans to spend the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in buying more shoes so that she can better run her shoe sales business.

loans.use: To buy shoes to improve her business

loans.name: And Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGGUEYE est créé depuis 2 ans et demi. Il est composé de 32 femmes provenant de quartiers différents mais qui nouent de bonne relations d'amitié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HERSENT2.

Madame DIABOU W. à l'extrême gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Depuis 04 ans elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend particulièrement des sandales et des habits. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer légèrement son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants: scolarité, nourriture, habillement etc.
texts.en:
he  “And Liggueye” solidarity group has been created two and a half years ago. It is composed of 32 women living in different districts but maintaining friendship ties. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Hersent2. 

Mrs. Diabou W., on the far left in the photo and raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 46 years old. She is divorced and the mother of 7. She also has another child in her, entrusted to her by relatives. She has had a small business for four years. She sells mainly sandals and clothing.
Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business somewhat by increasing her stock. Her goal is to provide for her children’s needs: schooling, food, clothing etc.

loans.use: Growing her business

loans.name: Alfredo Javier
