She is requesting a new loan to be able to stock up, as she already has several orders for clothing and shoes and does not have the necessary money for this investment. For this reason, she is requesting your support in this loan so that she can buy the order, so that her customers will keep buying.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Carla Ninoska

texts.es: Carla de 37 años de edad es soltera, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpadesde hace 10 años como responsable del departamento de fiscalizacion. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de un cuarto de su casa, pues desea poner el piso y repellarlo, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carla is 37 years old, single, and has been working for the Juigalpadesde town hall for 10 years, responsible for the inspections department. She is requesting her second loan with the objective of finishing construction in a room of her house. She would like to install the flooring and plaster the room, to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: Plaster of a room

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

Nuestra amiga Rosa  es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 9 años, es la actual presidenta del Banco y le gusta porque este es un banco que le ofrece mucha seguridad ya que todas sus compañeras son muy responsables. Ella tiene 38 años, está soltera y vive con su mama.
 
Tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende dulces, helados y golosinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, los helados y bolos los prepara ella, dice que esto lo aprendió hace muchos años y que los hace en varios sabores y son de mucho agrado de sus clientes. Tiene seis años en este negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, en temporadas playeras tiene muchas ventas ya que en esta temporada llegan muchos turistas.

Este crédito es para comprar dulces, golosinas y productos necesarios para preparar sus deliciosos helados, ya que se viene la temporada playera y vienen muchas personas. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Community Bank meet in the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton. This location is known for its lovely beaches which surround this beautiful area and are often visited by local and foreign tourists. This area is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".

Our friend Rosa has been a member of the Community Bank for 9 years already. She is currently the Bank's president, and she likes it because this is a bank that offers a lot of security, since all of the members are very responsible. She is 38, single, and lives with her mother.

She has a small store where she sells candies, ice cream and sweets. She works every day from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She makes the ice cream and candies herself. She says that she learned this many years ago, and that she makes several flavours which her customers like a lot. She has had this business for six years, and tells us that it is going very well. During the beach season she has many sales, as this is the season when many tourists arrive.

This loan is for buying candies, sweets and the necessary products for preparing her delicious ice creams, since the beach season is coming up and many people are coming. Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase candies, sweets and products for making ice cream.

loans.name: Blanca Eicidoris

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a La señora Blanca Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  cuatro hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad pero aun viven con ella, los otros de 17, 16 y 13 años estudian en colegio. Su esposo es electricista. Estuvo  en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio pero luego se retiró y volvió al mismo hace ya tres años, le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Ella tiene una carreta en la cual vende bocadillos, y comida rápidas entre lo que vende tenemos los corviches, empanadas, maduros fritos entre otros, trabaja todos los días sabados y domingos todo el dia, nos cuenta que esto lo viene realizando por muchos años ya que  es una forma decente de ganarse la vida y además porque es un negocio independiente que además le ha dado tiempo para estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, maní y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los productos que ella vende. Sus sueños son tener una casa mejor arreglada.
texts.en:
In the parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we find Blanca. She is 46 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children: one child is grown but still lives with her. The others are 17, 16, and 13 years old and are going to school. Her husband is an electrician. She has been with the communal bank almost since it started but then she left and came back again three years ago. She likes it because of the resources for going after loans.

She has a stand where she sells bocadillos (similar to sub sandwiches) and fast food, including corviches (deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish, and onion), pies, fried plantains, etc. She works every day, Saturdays and Sundays included, all day. She tells us that she has been doing this for years because it is a good way to make a living, besides it is an independent business, and it has given her time to take care of her children's needs.

This loan will be for buying plantains, peanuts, and other ingredients for preparing the products she sells. Her dream is to have a more tidy home.

loans.use: Purchase plantains, peanuts, and more products for making meals.

loans.name: Celia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Celia, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos  mayores de edad,  dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es pescador.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da, ella por su parte asiste a las reuniones del banco porque su esposo la mayor parte del tiempo se pasa ocupado en las faenas de la pesca, trabaja todos los días, su esposo y sus hijos que lo acompañan se van a la mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un barco más grande ya que el que tienen es pequeño.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Community Bank meet in the Crucita parish in the Portoviejo canton. This area is known for its lovely beaches that surround it and that are highly trafficked by local and international tourists. This area is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".

Here we meet Mrs Celia. She is 51 and in a common-law marriage from which she has five grown children, two of whom live with her. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who takes out loans for her husband's work or business (fishing and selling seafood) in order to help him. She attends the community bank meetings because her husband spends the majority of his time fishing. He works every day. Her husband and the children who accompany him go to the sea in the afternoon and return the next morning in order to offer their products to the merchants who come to their boats in order to take the products to markets in other cities.

This loan is for fuel, nets and other necessary materials for fishing. Celia has been a member of the Community Bank for five years, and she likes it because of the help that she receives with the loans. Her dream is to have a larger boat, since the one that they have is small.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, nets, and more materials for fishing.

loans.name: Paquita Solanda

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Solanda es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene  50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos una mayor de edad y otro de 14 años que estudia en colegio, los dos viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  además también vende productos de bazar, licores,  gaseosas, camarones y mariscos por libras.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda  cuando no está ocupado en sus actividades, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, camarones, licores, y otros productos. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Community Bank meet in the Crucita parish, Portoviejo canton. This area is known for its lovely beaches that surround it and are well-visited by local and international tourists. This area is known as "Crucita the Beautiful".

Mrs Solanda is a founding member of this Community Bank, and she likes it because of the additional benefits offered by the institution, and for the ease of getting loans. She is 50, married, and has two children from this relationship--one grown daughter and another 14-year-old child who is in school. They both live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a grocery store where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergents. She also sells miscellaneous products such as liquor, pop, shrimp and seafood by the pound. She works every day from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm, and sometimes later. Her husband helps her when he is not busy with his activities. She purchases her products in downtown Portoviejo, even though she has the majority of her products delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to stock her store further. She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, shrimp, liquor, and other products. Her goals are to continue expanding her business and her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, shrimp, liquor, etc.

loans.name: Odixa Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Odixa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido ir creciendo en su negocio y por ende mejorando su calidad de vida. Tiene  39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, uno  de 20 y una niña de 10 años que estudian en Universidad y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la cría de pollos.

Ella junto a su esposos se dedican a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que venden hasta 200 pollos por mes, los mismos que los tienen por dos meses para luego faenarlos y llevarlos a entregar a las tiendas de la localidad y de Portoviejo, trabajan todos los días en la alimentación y cuidados para tener una buena producción ya que dice que estos animalitos requieren de muchos cuidados porque si no podrían tener muchas pérdidas ya que estos son muy delicados, pero nos cuenta que gracias a Dios nunca han tenido muchas pérdidas.
p>
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para tener una buena producción. Sus sueños son tener un carro para transportar sus productos y las compras que realizan todos los meses.
texts.en:
In the parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

Odixa is the founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She is 39 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has two children: a son who is 20 and a daughter who is 10 years old. They are studying at the university and at school. Her husband raises chickens.

She and her husband raise chickens. She tells us that they sell up to 200 chickens a month. They have these chickens for two months so they can later slaughter them and take them to the local markets and the Portoviejo market. They work every day feeding and taking care of the chickens so they can have good production. She says that these little animals need a lot of care because if they are not cared for there can be many losses because the chickens are delicate. But she tells us that thanks to God, they have never lost many.

This loan is for buying chickens, feed, and medicines so they can have good production. Her dream is to have a car to transport her products and the purchases that they have every month.

loans.use: Buy chickens, feed, and medicines

loans.name: María Narciza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos,  seis de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la última tiene 15 años la misma que estudia en colegio, tres de sus hijos  viven con ella. El marido es pescador.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da,  trabaja todos los días, hay días que junto a otras personas se van a alta mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia  o hasta dos días y regresan por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son que siempre le vaya bien a su esposo y que en todos sus viajes regrese a salvo.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita communal bank meet in  Crucita parish in Portoviejo canton, an area known for being surrounded by beautiful beaches that are visited by national and foreign tourists.  It is called “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

Here we find Maria, 54, who lives in a common law marriage and has seven sons and daughters, six of whom are adults, and the youngest, is fifteen, a student.  Three of her sons and daughters live with her, and her husband is a fisherman.

Maria is a housewife who, to help her husband, requests the loan for her husband's work or business.   He goes fishing every day and sells the fish that is caught.  Some days he goes way out in the afternoons with other fishermen and they come back the next day, or even two days later, when they return to deliver their catch to the merchants who come to their boats to take the fish to the markets in other cities.

This loan will be used to buy fuel, nets, and other supplies necessary for fishing.  She has been a member of the communal bank and she likes it  for the help that she gets with the loans.  Her dreams are that everything always goes well for her husband and that he returns safely from his fishing trips.

loans.use: To buy fuel, nets and other supplies needed for fishing

loans.name: María Carmita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María. Tiene 51 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace muchos años tiene un hijo el cual ya está casado y vive con ella junto a su esposa y  dos hijos que son la alegría de nuestra amiga.

Tiene una heladería donde vende helados de la marca Pingüino en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio por 20 años y que fue una de las primeras que puso este tipo de negocio en su localidad y que gracias a Dios se ha mantenido y es así como pudo salir adelante a ella y  su hijo ya que hay que recordar que ella fue padre y madre a la vez.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus helados ya que se avecina la temporada playera y el negocio mejora considerablemente. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 19 años y le gusta por la forma como trabaja la institución  con sus clientes. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que la temporada sea muy buena.
texts.en:
In the parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we find Maria. She is 51 years old. She is single but she has a son through a relationship that she had years ago. He is married and lives with her along withhis wife and two children, who make our friend happy.

She has an ice cream shop where she sells Penguin brand ice creams. She works there every day from 8 am to 8 pm. She tells us that she has had this business for 20 years and that she was one of the first who opened this type of business in her area. Thanks to God, she has maintained it and that is how she was able to move forward with her son, since we must remember that she was both father and mother to him.

This loan is to buy more ice creams since beach season is coming up and business will pick up considerably. She has been a member of the communal bank for 19 years now, and she likes it because of how the organization works with its clients. Her dream is to keep working and that the season will be very good.

loans.use: Buy ice creams

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses son bajos. Tiene  45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos mayores y una linda chiquilla  de 17 años que  estudia  el último año de colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es economista de profesión y trabaja en un CDI. Como maestra parvularia.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el mismo que se dedica a la compra y venta de arroz, polvillo y arrocillo, los mismos que los compra en una pilladora en Charapoto y que luego lleva a entregar  por quintales a otras ciudades y en su localidad, también se dedica al cultivo de este producto, trabaja cuatro días a la semana, estos productos los deja a crédito hasta un mes de plazo y cobra de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes.  Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva en esta actividad ya por muchos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, polvillo e insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos. Sus sueños son seguir en su trabajo y que el negocio de sus esposo crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Crucita" meet in the parish of Crucita in the Portoviejo canton. This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and that are visited by many national and international tourists. It is known as Crucita The Beautiful.
Carmen is a founding member of the community bank, and she likes it because the loans are quickly granted and the interest is low. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children from this marriage, 2 of them adults and 1 is a pretty girl of 17 years old who is in her final year at high school. Her husband is in business. She is an economist by profession and works in a CDI as a preschool teacher. 
She is requesting the loan for her husband's business - he works buying and selling rice, polvillo, and arrocillo, which he buys in Charapoto and later distributes by the bushel in other towns in the area. He also grows these crops. He works at his job four days a week. These goods are bought on credit which lasts for up to a month, and then the customers pay in the way they prefer. Carmen tells us that her husband has been doing this work for many years and he has always done well. 
This loan is to buy rice, polvillo, and agricultural inputs for the crops. Her dreams is to continue working and she hopes that her husband's business keeps growing every day.

loans.use: To buy rice and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Laura Moserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Laura, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres ya son  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 12 años y estudia en colegio, sus hijos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es pescador. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya por 9 años y le gusta porque les han ayudado mucho para salir adelante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da,  trabaja todos los días, hay días que junto a otras personas se van a alta mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia  por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Sus sueños son que siempre haya buena pesca.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we meet Laura. She is 46 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children. Three are already grown and the youngest is 12 years old and goes to school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank for nine years, and she likes it because it has greatly helped her to move forward.

She is a housewife, who, to help her husband, gets the loans for his business. His business is fishing and selling the fruit that the ocean gives him. He works every day. There are some days that he goes out to high sea with other people in the afternoon and comes back the next morning to deliver his goods to vendors who visit his canoes to get the fish and take them to markets in other cities.

This loan is to purchase fuel, nets, and other materials needed for fishing. Her dream is that there will always be good fish.

loans.use: Purchase fuel, nets, and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  además también productos de bazar, licores,  gaseosas y ciertos medicamentos.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda, los productos los  compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su tienda ya por 32 años y que en ella se entretiene mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite,  licores, y otros productos.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque en las reuniones se divierte con sus compañeras del grupo. Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y más surtida.
texts.en:
The members of the Banco Comunal Crucita meet in Crucita, a town in the canton of Portoviejo. This lovely place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it, which receive a great number of tourists from Ecuador and beyond. It is known as "Beautiful Crucita."
Here we met Señora Mariana, who is 66 years old. She is married and she and her husband have two adult children, who are financially independent. Her husband works as a driver.
She has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oils, and detergents, as well as sundries, liquors, soft drinks, and a number of medicines. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. or even later. Her husband helps her by purchasing some goods in Portoviejo, although most of it is delivered directly to the store. She informs us that she's had her store for 32 years and enjoys it very much.
She will use this loan to stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, liquors, and other products. She is a founding member of the Banco Comunal and likes being a member because she has a good time at the meetings with the other members of the group. Her dream is to have a much larger store with a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, liquors, etc.

loans.name: Mayuri

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maryuri, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 15 y 9 años  edad de los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y a también vende en su casa. Trabaja todos los días unas tres horas por dia, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a   Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, cremas, perfumes y  otros productos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal ya por 32 ciclos y le gusta porque fue con uno de estos créditos que pudo iniciar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Crucita" meet in the parish of Crucita in the Portoviejo canton. This town is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place, and that are visited by many national and international tourists. It is known as Crucita The Beautiful.
Here we met Maryuri. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 9 and who are at high school and grade school. Her husband works for a company. 
She sells clothes of all sorts and products from the company Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells door to door and from her home. She works every day for three hours. She offers her clients credit and collects every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every couple of weeks or monthly, depending on what she needs.
This loan is for buying more clothes, particularly women's clothes, pants, blouses, creams, perfumes, and other products. She has been a member of the community bank for 32 loan cycles and she likes it because she was able to start her business with these loans. Her dream is to be successful with her business.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, pants, creams, perfumes, etc

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

Carmen  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudarse para seguir adelante con su negocio y así poder tener para mejorar su calidad de vida, ella tiene 54 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su hermano en casa de su familia.

Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de mariscos, tiene un local en su casa en el cual ofrece a sus clientes variedad de pescado y mariscos en general, trabaja cuatro días a la semana ya que hay días que hay veda y no se puede conseguir los mariscos ya que ella les compra a los pescadores que salen a pescar en sus pangas, nos cuenta que lleva ya 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha tenido días buenos y otros no tan buenos pero que ha logrado salir adelante a punta de trabajo y gracias también a los créditos.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, y otros mariscos. Sus sueños son tener un gran frigorífico.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Community Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

Carmen is a founding member of the community bank, and she likes it because she has been able to use the loans to help herself move forward with her business and thereby has been able to have a better quality of life. She is 54 years old; she is single and lives with her brother in his family's house.

She has a business buying and selling shellfish; she has a store in her home where she offers customers a variety of fish and shellfish in general. She works four days a week since there are days when there is a ban and she can't get the seafood since she buys it from the fishermen who go out to fish in their canoes. She tells us that she has been in this business for 20 years and she has had good days and not so good days, but she has been able to move forward because of her work and also thanks to the loans.

This loan is to purchase fish, shrimp, and other shellfish. Her dream is to have a large refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and more shellfish

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a Modesta ella tiene 55 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos los dan sin tantos requisitos y rápidos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar como: (licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros) a través de cartillas de la distribuidora La Gran Cadena, su forma de compra de todos los productos es al contado para luego ir entregando los productos según el turno de sus clientes, nos cuenta que ella lleva en este negocio el mismo tiempo que lleva esta distribuidora en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros productos y artefactos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando
texts.en:
The members of the Banco Comunal Crucita meet in Crucita, a town in the canton of Portoviejo. This lovely place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it, which receive a great number of tourists from Ecuador and beyond. It is known as "Beautiful Crucita."

Here we met Modesta, who is 55 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. She is a founding member of the Banco Comunal and likes it because she receives the loans quickly and without as much hassle.

She sells merchandise for the home such as blenders, irons, mattresses, etc. She sells the goods through catalogs from a distributor, La Gran Cadena, paying for them in full and then delivering them to her customers. She tells us she's been in this business as long as the distributor has been established in the city of Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to purchase blenders, irons, and mattresses, among other products. Her dreams are to be in good health and continue working.

loans.use: Purchase blenders, irons, mattresses, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Noemy, ella tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro ya son  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio, solo la última hija vive con ella y una nieta que esta pequeñita que es como su hija. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de mariscos, su forma de venta es ir bien en la mañana hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego transportarlo en su carro a otras ciudades y campos hasta donde llevan a vender sus productos, ellos entregan al por mayor y también al menudeo, trabajan cuatro días a la semana durante cinco a seis horas al día o hasta que se termine lo que compraron.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otras variedades de mariscos para llevar a sus clientes lo mejor. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños son tener otro carro en mejor estado.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Community Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we meet Noemy. She is 48 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has five children, four of whom are grown, and the youngest is 15 years old and goes to school. Only the youngest daughter lives with her, as well as a granddaughter who is little and is like a daughter. Her husband is a merchant.

She works with her husband selling shellfish. The business method is to go out early in the morning to the beaches to buy the best fish and later take them by car to other cities and towns where they sell their their products. They make deliveries mostly, and also sell retail. They work four days a week for five or six hours a day or until they finish selling what they bought.

This loan is to purchase fish, shrimp, and other varieties of shellfish to give their customers the best. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low compared to other credit organizations. Her dream is to have another car that is in better condition.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and more shellfish

loans.name: Oralia Floridalba

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cady de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Oralia, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca omnilife, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, entre los productos que más vende están el Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star bien y Biocron, la mayoría de estos son muy solicitados por sus clientes, lleva en esta clase de negocio ya por dos años y nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star bien y Biocron y otros productos más. Esta en el Banco Comunal por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus metas son tener algún dia un local.
texts.en:
In the area known as Cady in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Tamarind royalty, the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Grow) Community Bank meets every 15 days. This place is very lovely and the people very friendly.

In this place we meet Oralia. She is 43 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children who are 22, 18, 16, and 12 years old. All of them go to the university, high school, or elementary school, and all of them still live with her. Her husband is a professional chauffer.

She sells natural products from the Omnilife brand. Her sales method is to go door to door for orders. She works five days a week. She delivers her products on credit and collects every 15 days. Among the products that she sells most are Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star Bien, and Biocron. The majority of these are highly requested by her customers. She has been in this business for two years already and she tells us it is going very well.

This loan will go to purchase Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star Bien, and Biocron, and other products. She has been with the community bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the resources for going after loans. Her goal is to have her own store someday.

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products

loans.name: Margarita Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora, Margarita ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y de 16 y 15  los mismos que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun están en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante de electrodomésticos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo  por catalogo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio 8 años y que ha tenido temporadas buenas y malas pero siempre ha salido adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa camisas,  pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener su local.
texts.en:
In the Cadí section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Will Grow) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a very beautiful place and the people are very likeable.

We met Margarita, 46, here.  She is married and has five children.  Three of them are adults and the other two are 16 and 15 years of age and in school.  All the children still live at home.  Her husband is a home appliance salesman.

She sells all kinds of clothing via catalogue sales.  She sells door to door and also from her house where she has a small store.  She tells us that her customers place orders with her.  She works five days a week and grants her customers credit; she collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo every two weeks or once a month depending on her needs.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for 8 years and has had both good and bad seasons but she has always gotten ahead.

This loan is to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children’s clothes, among others.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution provides.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Narcisa De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

La señora Narcisa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos y por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene  51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijas los cuales ya son mayores de edad y están casadas,  con ella viven tres nietos de 18, 16 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Entre lo que más vende están los cosméticos, cremas, perfumes y ropa de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de mujeres. Sus sueños son arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
In the area known as Cadi in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Tamarind royalty, the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Grow) Community Bank meets every 15 days. This place is very lovely and the people very friendly.

Narcisa is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low and also because of the resources for going after loans. She is 51 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has five daughters who are all grown and married. Three grandchildren live with her; they are 18, 16, and 11 years old and go to high school and elementary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

She is a housewife, and to make her own money she sells clothing by catalog as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works three days a week. She delivers her products on credit and collects each week or every 15 days, whichever her customers want. She receives her (Yanbal) products at home and the clothing at a distribution center. She mostly sells cosmetics, lotions, perfumes, and women's clothes.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and women's clothes. Her dream is to organize her home.

loans.use: Buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and women's clothes

loans.name: Lissette Rafaela

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lissette,  tiene 33 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hermosa bebita de 3 meses.  Su marido es Ing. Industrial pero no ejerce su profesión por el momento, ella es egresada de secretariado ejecutivo.

Ellos tienen una tienda de viveras de consumo en la casa de sus padres en la cual venden productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, trabajan todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos las compras en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que tienen este negocio ya por 14 años y que gracias a Dios le ha dado para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the Cadí section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Will Grow) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a very beautiful place and the people are very likeable.

We met Lissette, 33, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a beautiful, 3 month old, baby girl.  Her husband is an Industrial Engineer but he does not practice his profession for the moment.  She graduated as an Executive Secretary.

They have a grocery store in her parents’ house where they sell products like: rice, sugar, oils and detergents.  They work every day from 6am until 10pm and sometimes even later.  She buys her products in Portoviejo although most are delivered to her store.  She tells us that they’ve had this business for 14 years and, thanks be to God, it’s produced enough for them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because she has made more friendships in the group.  Her dreams are to have a house of her own and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic need items.

loans.name: Tania Jessenia

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tania, ella tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos chicas de 14, 13 años y el último que es varón siete meses  de  edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es supervisor en una camaronera en Guayaquil.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo y con este crédito quiere viajar a Guayaquil a comprar mercadería para la temporada.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa de temporada como bermudas, camisetas, trajes de baño, gorras, entre otras prendas. Estuvo en el inicio del  Banco comunal pero se retiro por un ciclo y ahora este es su segundo ciclo, le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener una boutique bien surtida.
texts.en:
In the Cadí section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Will Grow) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a very beautiful place and the people are very likeable.

We met Tania, 31, here.  She’s married and has three children: two girls who are 13 and 14 and a son who is 7 months old; the two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a Supervisor at a Guayaquil shrimp processing plant.

She sells clothing by catalogue door to door and also from home where she has a small store.  She tells us that customers place orders from her.  She works every day of the week granting her customers credit that she collects on every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and wants to use this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy merchandise for the season.

This loan will be used buy seasonal clothes like: Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits and caps, among other items.  She was a member of the bank at its inception but dropped out for a cycle.  Now she’s back in her second cycle.  She likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to have a well stocked boutique.

loans.use: To buy Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits, caps, etc.

loans.name: Maryjane's Group

texts.en:
Maryjane is living from the village of Lourmah, Mahayag Zds.She is 43 years old with 5 children,and his husband is a motorcab driver. She has 1 son working at Malaysia. Maryjane is the group leader of the 4 member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group are responsible for  their obligations, they also help one another. Maryjane works hard at her vegetable garden everyday. She sells her produce twice a week in the market to lot of buyers from different places. She has been gardening for 5 years with husband support to help meet  their daily needs. Since she started becoming  a PMPC member their living situation has improved. 

Maryjane requesting for new loan in amount of Php. 10,000.00 of additional capital for her vegetable gardening.Through the help of PMPC she is very thankful for the blessings because its supports the immediate needs of her family.

.PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE is one of the progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao.It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen Model.

loans.use: For  additional capital for Vegetable Gardening

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P., is from the barangay of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married and has seven children. To make a living, Lilia sells dried fish in the local community. She has been in business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In January 2010, Lilia joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilia is now requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. This will be 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Aneta P. is from the village of Carangan Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age and married to Bernardo P., a security guard. They were blessed with two children. Anita is presently engaged in buying and selling dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In April 2006, Aneta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es una cliente de 29 años de edad,  que vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia, la cual ha construido con mucho esfuerzo y abnegación.  Su casita está ubicada en Catacaos, en la región Piura, a mas o menos 4 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales los ofrece en una pequeña bodega.  Esta bodega la tiene desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, y gracias a la buena atención que brinda tiene mucha clientela, quienes la estiman y la apoyan.

Carmela quiere comprar más productos para poder ofrecerlos en su bodega y así satisfacer la demanda que tiene en la actualidad.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmela is 29 years old and lives with her children in their own house, which she built with a lot of hard work and self-control. Her home is located in Catacaos, in Piura region, more or less 4 hours from Chiclayo city, capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmela sells basic goods in her small grocery store. Her store is about 8 years old and has a number of loyal customers who support and think highly of Carmela, thanks to her good customer service.

She hopes to stock her store with new items to meet the current demand from her customers. To meet this goal, Carmela is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of more items for grocery store.

loans.name: Amistad 6 Group

texts.en: Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Amistad 6 (Friendship), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in El Seybo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children. Carmen is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza. Notably, she has already successfully repaid her previous loan which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells underwear, so the loan will be used to purchase them for kids and women. She will invest the profits in completing her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chickens to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 28 años es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado ser muy responsable con su familia por eso comenzó a buscar trabajo y pesar de la falta de oportunidades comenzó a trabajar como taxista. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana esta actualmente trabajado en un taxi privado ya que poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación obtuvo clientela para poder mantener a su familia. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00pm. Aunque a pesar que la delincuencia está creciendo y es más peligroso salir con el carro el sigue trabajando para generar dinero. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando y darle un buen vivir a su familia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento y bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is a hard worker that has always liked being responsible for his family.  For that reason he started to look for work despite the lack of opportunities.  He began working as a cab driver.

He lives in a suburban area and is currently works driving a private taxi, and with work and dedication has obtained a clientele in order to support his family.  He works from 6:00am until 10:00pm.  Even though crime is on the rise and it's more dangerous to go out with the car he continues working in order to generate money.

He has many aspirations for the future, and so wants to keep working and give a good life to his family.  That's why he wants the loan to buy construction materials like cement and bricks.  He eventually wants to finish building his house.

loans.use: Cement, bricks

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos.  Vive con su familia en el distrito de Catacaos en la Ciudad de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de sandalias y ropa en el mercado de su localidad.  Por la buena atención que brinda cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que la estima y la apoya.  Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, pavos, patos y gallinas, los cuales engorda para venderlos posteriormente, con la finalidad de percibir ingresos y ayudar a su familia.

Maria quiere adquirir más mercadería para poder venderla y aumentar sus ingresos, para poder ayudar a su familia.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children.  She lives with her family in the Catacaos district of the city of Piura, 4 hours from the city of Ciclayo, capital of Lambayeque department.

She works selling sandals and clothes in her local market.  From the favorable attention she has gained she has a faithful clientele that thinks highly of her and helps her.  She also works raising animals such as pigs, turkeys, ducks, and chickens, which she fattens up to sell later, from which she gets her income and helps her family.

Maria wants to acquire more merchandise to sell in increase her income in order to help her family.  To achieve her goal she's decided to get a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 2,000 soles.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Embajadores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en: Odania is the coordinator of her group, Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors"). The group is made up of Haitian members, all of them emigrated from Haiti during different periods. Odania's story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. Odania is excited to be seeking her seventh loan with Esperanza. Notably, she already successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells clothes, so the loan will be used to purchase jeans, shirts, skills, underwear and other things for kids, women and men. She will invest the profits from her business by buying more merchandise and she will save some money for her future plans. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 58 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la producción y comercialización de yogurt. Ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta al público en general durante todos los días. El negocio es bastante conocido en la zona y actualmente ella cuenta con una clientela estable y fidelizada. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten ayudar a su familia con su sostenimiento diario.

María desea ampliar su producción con la compra de más insumos y materiales que le permitan seguir vendiendo y distribuyendo sus productos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 58 years old, separated, and lives together with her family in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area of regular commercial traffic that is located in Lambayeque province, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She works producing and selling yogurt.  She makes this food in her home and sells it to the general public every day.  Her business is well-known in the area and she currently has a stable and loyal clientele.  The income she makes from this business allows her to help her family with its daily upkeep.

Maria wants to increase her production with the purchase of more ingredients and materials that will allow her to continue selling and distributing her products.  For this reason she needs to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 800 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase of more ingredients and materials to prepare more products.

loans.name: Mercedes Marien

texts.es:
Mercedes de 44 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que no está casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Tiene un negocio de venta de pollos hace ya 6 años atrás ya que su mama siempre le enseño a criar pollos y gallinas en su niñez. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso ha estado trabajando durante años vendiendo pollos listo para prepara y cocinar desde las 05h00pm que abre el puesto hasta las 12h00 que se le terminan los pollos. Tiene muchas aspiración para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su trabajo para asegurar su fututo. Con el préstamo espera comprar balanceado para pollos ya que no solo vende los pollos sino que primero los cría y después los mata para la venta.  

En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio en otra zona para tener mas cliente y si es posible en un mercado
texts.en:
Mercedes, 44, is a hard worker who is unmarried with 3 grown children.  She has had her business selling chickens for 6 years, with her mother teaching her to raise them during her childhood.

She lives in a suburban area called Paraiso and has works selling chickens ready to cook from 5:00am when she opens to noon.  She has many aspirations for the future and so wants to continue with her work in order to fulfill them.  With the loan she wants to buy chicken feed since she not only sells the chickens but raises and slaughters them first.

In the future she wants to improve her business in another area in order to have more clientele and if possible sell from a market.

loans.use: Chicken feed

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 63 años D. edad, es separada y resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Pomape del distrito D. Monsefú, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desD. que era joven. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno D. cultivo en donD. suele sembrar diversos vegetales y legumbres. Cuando llega el tiempo D. cosecha las comercializa en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

María siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que siembre se desarrollen D. mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is 63 years old, separated, and lives with her family in the hamlet of Pomape in Monsefu district, an agricultural area some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works as a farmer, which she has done since she was young.  She counts on her small plot where she grows various vegetables and legumes.  At harvest time, she sells them in the wholesale market in Chiclayo.  Her business alows her to help her family with their daily needs.

Maria always works hard in order to keep her business moving forward.  Currently she wants to apply various fertilizers to her land so that the fruits she hopes to plant will grow better.  She has therefore seen fit to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 1,600 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to be able to plant fruits.

loans.name: Deysi Diana

texts.es:
Deysi de  28 años, es una joven trabajadora que comenzó hace 3 años atrás con su pequeña tienda  con un capital de $ 300.00. Poco a poco y con ayuda de su esposo ha incrementado la mercadería que vende en la tienda ya que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa.

Viviendo en una zona muy turística llamada Playas (conocida porque tiene uno de los mejores climas en todo el mundo) continúa trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus tres hijos que están estudiando. En su tienda tiene a la venta arroz, bebidas, enlatados, azúcar entre otros. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso que por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados y otros víveres de primera necesidad. En el futuro quiere tener nuevas instalaciones en su tienda para su mejora de ingresos.
texts.en:
Deysi is 28 years old. She is a hard working young woman who opened her small store 3 years ago with $300 of capital. Little by little, and with her husband's help, she has increased the merchandise she sells in her store, which is located in the front of her house.  

Living in a very touristy area called Playas (known for having one of the best climates in the world), she continues to work to give a good life to her children, who are in school. In her store, she sells rice, beverages, canned goods, sugar, and more. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day.  

She aspires to a lot of things for her business. That is why she wants the loan to buy rice, canned goods and other basic necessity products. In the future, she wants to have new facilities in her store to improve her income.

loans.use: Rice, sugar

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres menores hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Las Lomas, una localidad situada en la región Piura y ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas como cerveza y chicha (bebida típica del país hecha a base D. un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz llamada jora). Ella ofrece estas bebidas en su domicilio durante los fines D. semana. Su negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que ambas bebidas son bastante populares en la zona. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más insumos que le permitan ampliar su producción y sus ventas, D., modo que pueda percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Rosa, age 37, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in the Las Lomas agricultural district, located in the Piura region over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells drinks such as beer and chicha (a typical drink from this country, maD. from a special type of cornflour called jora). She sells these drinks in her home on the weekends. Her business is quite well-received, as both drinks are very popular in the area. She uses the income from this work to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the household costs.

Rosa would like to acquire more supplies that will allow her to expand her production and sales, in order to make a better income, allowing her to help get her family ahead. In order to achieve this goal, she has found it necessary to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to acquire supplies to increase her production.

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el sector Monteverde del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar frutas como mango y limón. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Lubinda siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lubinda, age 32, is married with three children. She lives with her husband in the Monteverde sector, Tambogrande district, in the Piura province, in the region of the same name. This region is known as an area where the population works principally in fruit cultivation.

She has worked in agriculture from her youth. She has a small plot of land where she normally plants fruits such as mango and lemon. When harvest time arrives, she sells them to the local processing plants. This business allows her to help her family with their daily living expenses.

Lubinda always works hard in order to be able to get her business ahead. She currently wants to fertilize her land with various fertilizers so that the fruit that she harvests in the future will be better developed. Thus, she has decided to request a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 47 años, es vendedora de productos Yanbal y productos naturales es madre soltera porque hace años murió su esposo y ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado como vendedora informal de productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y productos naturales a base de noni. Trabaja con ayuda de uno de sus hijos repartiendo los productos desde muy temprano. 

Tiene muchas aspiración para seguir trabajando por eso quiere continuar vendiendo su mercadería con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere seguir manteniendo ese ritmo de ingresos.
texts.en:
María, age 47, is a vendor of Yanbal products and natural products. She is a single mother, because her husband passed away a few years ago, and she has had to take care of their children.

She lives in an urban zone called Orquideas. She works as an informal vendor of Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, deodorants and natural products made of noni fruit. One of her children helps her, and they start selling very early in the morning.

She has many goals for continuing to work, and so she wants to keep selling her merchandise. With this loan, she wants to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she wants to continue maintaining this rhythm of income.

loans.use: perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Dilmer

texts.es:
Dilmer es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chulucanas, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra situada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en su domicilio. Específicamente cuenta con ovejas, cabras y aves de corral, las cuales alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos animales ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad son la principal fuente ingreso con la que sostiene la economía de su familia.

Dilmer desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta y pueda aumentar sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Dilmer is a 40 year old father.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the Chulucanas district.  It is an agricultural and commercial zone, which is located in the Piura region.  It is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has some small animals, which he raises at his home.  Specifically, he has sheep, goats, and poultry.  He feeds them with grains and natural fodder.  When these animals have reached a good level of development, he sells them to the general public and to the businessmen who usually visit the zone where he lives.  The income that he gets from this business activity is the primary source of income to support his family.

Dilmer wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed.  That way he will be able to meet the demand that he has, and he will be able to increase his earnings.  That is why he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 800 soles from Edpyme Alternative.  The loan will help with his objective.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Maranatha 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yaque is one of the members of the Maranatha 1 & 2 Group where almost all of the members are Haitians. They are located in La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Yaque is a single mother of 5 and she makes her home here in a simple structure in a rural community surrounded by sugar cane field, This village is part of Bateyes noted for it's sugar cane industry, in the tourism city of Romana.

Yaque is excited about seeking her first loan with Esperanza. It will enable her to expand her business, started 2 years ago with own savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of Second hand cloths, by purchasing bags of used cloths in good conditions. Also, she will buy curtains, bedlinen and other decoration products. Her profits will be use to supply their family's need.

loans.use: to buy second hand cloths

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en:
Itaf O. is married and the mother of one daughter, Zeinab, 23 years old, and one son, Mahmoud, 20 years old. Both her children are students. Itaf and her family live in Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. Itaf's husband, Muhamamd, has been running a home products store for 10 years, selling kitchen and table products such as glasses, pans, spoons, etc. Itaf took a loan from FATEN so that her husband could purchase a larger variety of goods to sell and increase his returns.

Muhamamd is pictured in the photo as Itaf is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of goods

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam, 36 years old, is married and the mother of one daughter and two sons. Inaam and her family came back to Palestine recently. She and her husband own a house in the city where they live, and they want to furnish it. Inaam came to FATEN to get a loan to purchase basic home furniture such as beds and couches. Inaam's husband has retired recently.

Inaam's husband, Muhammad, appears in the photo since Inaam is a conservative woman who is not comfortable with her picture being on the web.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en: Mutaz is a 24-year-old man from Palestine. He is an employee who is getting married next summer. In order to have his wedding on time, he came to FATEN and took a $1,000 loan to finish preparing the house. Mutaz bought a kitchen table and sitting room chairs and couches with his loan money.

loans.use: to finish preparing the house for his wedding next summer

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar Minawai is a young man from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. Omar finished school and wanted to start a business. His father owns a shop in the city, so Omar decided to use the shop and start a fishing supplies and equipment store as Gaza City is located by the sea.

Omar took a loan from FATEN to purchase some of the goods, such as fishing nets and hooks, that he wants to sell in the store.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for his new store

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa, 43 years old, is married and the father of two daughters and three sons. The family lives in Tulkarem in Palestine, where his wife is a nurse in a public hospital. Musa's shoulder was hurt badly during the first Intifada and has been trying to fix it since then. Musa decided to go to Jordan to receive treatment and came to FATEN to get a loan to help him cover the expenses.

loans.use: to cover his medical expenses in Jordan

loans.name: Izz Adin

texts.en:
