Izz Adin is a 26-year-old young man from Tulkarem City in northern Palestine.  Izz Adin is a wholesale trader.  He purchases large amounts of shoes and resells them to small shops in the city.  He exports other types of goods according to the season.

Izz Adin requests a loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner FATEN to pay for the purchase of a large amount of shoes to export. 

Izz appears in FATEN's office in the attached photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of shoes to sell to small shops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large fish display refrigerator

loans.name: Khairi

texts.en:
Khairi is a 34-year-old man from Tulkarem City and works as an employee of the Palestinian Academy for Security Sciences. Khairi is one of four brothers.  He is engaged, with his wedding planned for next summer.

He requested a loan from Kiva partner FATEN to cover his wedding expenses, which include the cost of booking the wedding hall and other expenses.

Khairi appears in the picture at FATEN's office.

loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloths to sell in the store

loans.name: C6220 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Bernadette is 46 years old and is married with three children between the ages 5 and 12 years old. She is the representative of a group which is called Abizerwa in the local language.

Bernadette owns a small shop which sells green bananas and she has two years experience in the business. She employs three persons in her business as  helpers so that her business will run well. Her business starts at 6am until 7pm, every day except Sunday.

Bernadette and her group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses for the purpose of earning more profits. With the profits, they expect to improve their businesses. Bernadett in particularly, needs a fridge which will allow her to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid S. is a 29-year-old man from Bethlehem City who runs a grocery store in the city in partnership with another man from Bethlehem. Eid hopes to own the grocery store.  Therefore, he works constantly to increase the business' returns.  In addition to his work at the grocery store, Eid installs electricity networks for new houses and saves the money to buy all the shares of the store.

Eid came to Kiva partner FATEN to request a loan to purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the store.  The new items would be additional to the wide range of items he currently sells.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Thaera

texts.en:
Thaera is a young wife and the mother of three daughters and one son. Thaera's husband is a cement and concrete factory guard. Thaera and her family moved to a bigger house last year and the house urgently needed painting. Thaera borrowed money from her parents to pay for the painting and couldn't repay the entire amount. She therefore took out a loan from FATEN and repaid her parents, as it's easier for her husband to repay the money in smaller amounts to FATEN.

Thaera's husband appears in the photo instead of her as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: to repay her parents the money she borrowed to paint the house

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, who is from Bethlehem, owns a car engine repair workshop located in the the industrial area of Bethlehem, which attracts a good number of customers. George is one of FATEN's reliable clients. He took his second loan from FATEN to purchase an engine repair machine to replace his old one. George is the father of one daughter and two sons, who are all students.

loans.use: to purchase an engine repair machine

loans.name: C6222 Dususuruke Group

texts.en:
Theopiste is 30 years old and is married with two children who are between the ages of 3 and 6 years old. She also takes care of two dependents from her family.

Her business is to sell a variety of clothes; her business is famous as well as organized. She describes herself as a hardworking woman in her daily activities. Her business is open from 6am until 5pm every day except Saturday.

Theopiste has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more bales of clothes. This purchase will allow her to serve more customers from the community which will help her to earn more money.

The profits she expects to earn will be one of the ways she will develop her business and will provide all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Muhamamd

texts.en: Muhammad S., 22 years old, is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Muhamamd took a loan from FATEN in order to purchase a computer. He is an ambitious Palestinian; he wants to have a computer in order to start an online course and broaden his knowledge.

loans.use: personal computer

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is married and has no children. Her husband, a National Palestinian Authority employee, is having a problem in his wrist and he requires surgery. Raghda came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for part of the cost of the surgery as they don't have enough money to pay the entire amount at once.

Raghda's husband appears in the photo as Raghda is a religious woman and didn't want her picture posted online.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another greenhouse

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 23 years old and he is still single. He is known in the business of selling tea in a restaurant and this is his nineteenth successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 5.30am until 10pm every day.

Theoneste has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more stock for his small restaurant. With this additional business, Theoneste will hopefully earn more profits than his previous business. With these profits, one portion will be used to build a secure future for his family, as he is in the process of getting engaged to be married. The other portion of his profits will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for expand  his small restaurant

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad M. owns a poultry and goat farm. He sells chicken for butcheries and produces milk for sale. Muhammad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase chicken feed and more chickens to raise as he doesn't have enough liquidity to cover all the farm expenses at the moment.

Muhammad is the father of three daughters and four sons. Some of the sons are old enough to help him on the farm while the rest are still students.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hanan is married to Muhammad A. H. and they have four daughters and four sons. Hanan's daughters are in school and university. Her sons who are old enough work with their father in the shoe store they own. One of her sons works on the other side of the wall.

Hanan's husband bought a large amount of shoes to sell during the holidays and feasts and didn't have enough liquidity to pay the full amount in cash. Therefore, he needed a $1,000 loan, which Hanan took out from FATEN to help her husband pay for the shoes.

Hanan's husband appears in the photo as Hanan is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of shoes

loans.name: Shuja'

texts.en:
Shuja' is a young man from Jenin. He works in an engineering company. Shuja, his brothers and his father share in taking care of the family and house expenses.

Shuja's father has a car maintenance workshop. HIs father had to borrow money from relatives to improve the workshop, paint the walls and replace some of the old tools he uses. Shuja' took a loan from FATEN to pay back his father's debt.

Shuja' appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: Car workshop improvement

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Her sons own a barber shop in the city of Jenin. Both of her sons are married and provide for their families as well as for their mother and their sisters, who are still students.

Nadera took a loan from FATEN to help her sons improve the barber shop by painting the walls and replacing one of the old barber chairs in the shop.

Nadera's son Raed appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: Paint the shop and purchase a barber chair

loans.name: Khaldeyye

texts.en:
Khaldeyye I. the mother of one son and four daughters. Her husband is a National Authority employee. She and her husband moved to their new house a couple of years ago.

Now that their son and daughters are older, they have decided to prepare one of the rooms for the son and leave the other room for the daughters. For this purpose Khaldeyye took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the remodeling expenses.

Khaldeyye's husband appears in the picture here in FATEN's office instead of her, because she is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture on the web.

loans.use: final touches of a new constructed house

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old man from Jenin city. He came to FATEN to take out a loan to purchase a television and some bedroom furniture. He is single and wants to prepare the house for his wedding. Mahmoud is a security guard in one of the companies in Jenin city.

Mahmoud appears in the picture here in Jenin's branch office.

loans.use: to purchase a television and bedroom furniture

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is married with two teenage daughters. She is a small market entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Raisa sells household items such as candles, shoe polish, seeds, farming chemicals, etc. in the central marketplace ‘Troyan’ with the help of her husband. Raisa has been in this trade for 4 years. Presently, she earns 7,000 Grivnyas each month. 

Raisa is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted candles as well as seeds for the upcoming spring farming season. Her business is the main source of income for her family. Raisa is hoping to generate sufficient income to help both of her daughters through college. Besides running the business, Raisa is also a columnist for a local newspaper called ‘ZPS-Inform’.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: frozen products and pig fattening businesses. Her husband Marcellus T., who is 46 years old, works as a employee (fishing vessels) to earn his living. They have three children who are 14 to 23 years old. Joyce joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joyce has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to pay for more purchase more stock to sell so that she could continue to save up for future for family needs. Joyce is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Sydney

texts.en:
Maria Sydney is 36-years old single and supports her family by operating two business ventures: networking (natasha, MSE) and electronic re-loading businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her networking (selling Natasha and MSE Personal Products) and electronic re-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Maria Sydney is borrowing PHP 19500 so that she could fund operations.  This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Sydney aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

Her previous loan of PHP 22500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Mernel

texts.en: Mernel is a widow who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and eatery businesses. She has five children who are between 5 to 19 years old, all of them are currently going to school. Mernel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mernel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to pay for more funds in business operation so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Mernel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em M. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province and she is 50 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Hen Ros, is a palm juice collector who is able to earn some money from selling sugar palm and he is a coconut and fire wood seller, too. In the plantation, she has some problem because it is time for plow, so she needs two oxen for plow. To improve this purpose, Mrs. Em M. is asking for a loan to buy two oxen for plow. She is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy two oxen for plow

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda I.'s main source of income comes from selling electronic products in her community. She is 55 years old, widowed and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rosenda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pineapple 2 Group

texts.en:
Veolita P. operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Pob. Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. Veolita has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Veolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Veolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

Veolita is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Pineapple 2".

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for a restaurant

loans.name: Phai

texts.en: Mrs. Phai P. is living in Sramaoch Haer village in Takeo province she was born in 1977. She married to Mr. Leng Sem both of them has five children, three of whom are attending in local public school, but the others are too young to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family while her husband is a duck and chicken breeder who can earn some money to support his family and he is a fisherman, too. Recently her husband’s business is going well, so she wants to expand. To improve this purpose, Mrs. Phai P. is seeking for a loan to buy more chickens and rest of the loan she is going to buy more duck and chicken food. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin B. is from the village of Margos Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Jasmin is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmin owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Jasmin is just starting this business.

In 2011, Jasmin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jasmin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey H. is married woman with four children, three of whom are studying in local public school, but the youngest one is five years old. She and her family are living in Ta Muong village in Takeo province. She was born in 1966. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Van Sok, is a construction worker and fisherman. Although they do a lot of work, they can earn a little income. So to improve her family living, Mrs. Srey H. is requesting for a loan to buy a cow, some piglets, and pig food for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow, some piglets, and pig food

Leo is just starting this business.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey V. lives in Samraong village in Takeo province and she was born in 1961. She has three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, while the others are too young to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family and her husband, Mr. Tet Ut, is a construction worker to earn some money to support his family standard living. To improve her family living, Mrs. Mey V. is applying for a loan to buy three hundred fifty ducks and a ton of duck food for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy three hundred fifty ducks and a ton of duck food

loans.name: Lilibeth's Group

texts.en:
Lilibeth C. is from the village of Nangalisan. She is 40 years old. Lilibeth is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lilibeth C..

Lilibeth is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Lilibeth is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilibeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 26 años, es casada y vive con su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, en la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Tiene una bodega donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes, además de chicha (una bebida a base de un tipo de harina llamada jora) y cerveza.  La bodega se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, con la finalidad de atender a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesiten.  Adicionalmente cuenta con ganado caprino, el cual engorda y cuando ya están lo suficientemente desarrollados los vende a su clientela que a la fecha están fidelizados por el buen trato que da.Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al fortalecimiento de la economía de su familia

Gladys, desea obtener más mercadería para su posterior venta, lo cual incrementaría sus ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente  obtener un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the Tambogrande district in the Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque department.

She has a store where she sells all sorts of groceries, plus chicha (a beverage made from a type of flour called jora) and beer. The store is in her own home so that she can take care of her children when they need her. She also relies on income from goats, which she fattens, and when they are sufficiently developed, she sells them to her customers. At this time, the customers are faithful to her because of the good treatment she gives them. With her income, she helps strengthen her family's economic situation.

Gladys wants to obtain more merchandise for her sales, which will boost her income. To meet her goal she hopes to receive a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her sales

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin S. is a farming laborer and a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family living while her husband, Mr. Vet Ut, is a construction worker who is able to earn some money to support his family, too. In the present, she has a problem because her husband’s work place is far away from her home. So Mrs. Kin S. is requesting for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband transports to do work. She and her family are living in Samraong village in Takeo province. They have four children whom all are studying in local public school. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertja es madre de familia de 63 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra situada en la región de Lambayeque, a 45 minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en su domicilio. Específicamente cuenta con chivos, cuyes, pavos, patos, gallinas, chanchos, etc., los que alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos animales ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad son la principal fuente ingreso con la que sostiene la economía de su familia.

Bertha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta y pueda aumentar sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Bertja is the mother of a family. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Mochumi district, an agricultural and commercial area that is located in the Lambayeque region, a 45-minute walk from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has some young animals that she cares for in her home. Specifically, she has goats, guinea pigs, turkeys, ducks, hens, pigs, etc., who she feeds grains and natural grasses. When these animals reach a good level of development, she sells them to the general public and to businesses that visit the area she lives in. The revenue she generates from this business is her main form of income that sustains her family economically. 

Bertha wants to grow her business by buying more animals and balanced feed so she can satisfy demand and increase her revenue. Therefore, she has requested this loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles, which will help her meet her goal.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona urbano- marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la zona es conocida en la zona norte del país por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en el domicilio en donde reside. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y conocidos diversos productos de uso diario, los cuales son de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos. Ella ofrece en venta estos productos brindando siempre un trato amable y servicial, por lo que siempre cuenta  con una clientela estable y fidelizada. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos de su familia.

María desea adquirir más productos para lograr satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Francisca is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the suburbs of Chiclayo. The area is known in the northern part of the country for its abundant commerce and transport.

She sells basic-needs items and groceries in a store out of her home. There she offers her neighbors and acquaintances an array of daily-use products, which are very useful for her neighbors. She sells these products and gives friendly, helpful service, which is why she always has a stable and loyal clientele. The revenue she generates from this business is used to help her husband with household expenses.

Maria wants to acquire more products to satisfy current demand. Therefore, she has requested this loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles, which will help her meet her goal.

loans.use: Acquire more products to sell

loans.name: Nesfora

texts.en: To make a living, Nesfora A. owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Dban, Calamba, Mis. Occ. Nesfora has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Nesfora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nesfora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for a restaurant

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una de las comunidades urbano-marginales el distrito de Pimentel, un distrito cuyo atractivo principal es un balneario turístico situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella adquiere prendas de vestir en la ciudad de Lima y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos por pedidos. Viviana suele trabajar tanto al crédito como al contado y su negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Viviana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de prendas de vestir de temporada de verano de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 35 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and their children in one of the semi-urban communities in the district of Pimentel.  The principal tourist attraction in Pimentel district is a water park located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Viviana sells items of clothing to the general public.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima and offers it for sale to her neighbors and acquaintances by taking orders.  She works on credit as well as for cash and her business has allowed her to help her husband meet the economic needs of their family.

Viviana would like to expand her business with the purchase of fashionable garments for the summer season, in order to satisfy the current demand.  This is why she decided to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will help her to meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy summer garments to resell

loans.name: Jailyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Jailyn C. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, spices, canned goods, pancit (fresh noodles), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Jailyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Jailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prach

texts.en:
Mrs. Prach C. was born in 1967 and lives in Samraong village in Takeo province. She is married with five children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are enrolled in public school. She and her husband, Mr. Nem Sok, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Nem Sok is also a construction worker.
Mrs. Prach C. has an ox, but she is not able to plow the rice field with just one ox. To improve this situation, Mrs. Prach C. is requesting a loan to buy another ox so that she has two oxen to plow.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Maria Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa de 26 años,  tiene una pequeña panadería que desde hace años atrás  ha estado administrando para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana ha estado trabajando en su pequeña panadería desde que la liquidaron de su trabajo y con el dinero ahorrado compro harina, mantequilla y huevos para hacer panes y venderlos a sus vecinos. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano elaborando los panes en su pequeño local.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar haciendo panes con ayuda de mas personal pero para lograr incrementar su negocio necesita comprar con el préstamo harina, mantequilla, huevos para su panadería.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 26 years old, has a small bakery that she started years ago to be able to take care of her two children, since she is a single mother.

Living in an urban area, she has been working in her small bakery since they closed down her work, and with the money she saved, she bought flour, butter, and eggs to make breads and sell them to her neighbors. Now she works starting very early (in the morning), making the breads in her little shop.

She has many aspirations for her business, and this is why she wants to continue making breads with help from more staff, but in order to grow her business she needs to buy flour, butter, and eggs for her bakery with this loan.

loans.use: Flour, butter, eggs

loans.name: Raima's Group

texts.en:
Loans provided by Kiva are a great opportunity especially for women, since they are one of the most unprotected part of society in many eastern countries. 

Raima M., 43, is the leader of this group. A year ago she started working in clothing retail in a local market. Retail requires a big starting capital for obtaining inventory, a rental space and taxes. Raima gets her goods in a local wholesale market, where the significant part of goods are imported from neighboring countries such as China, Kazakhstan and Russia. Raima is happy with how she managed the first year in this business. Her 16 year old daughter helps her out after school and Raima has good predictions for long-term business. With the returns from her business, she purchased a dairy cow for having fresh milk products for the entire family. Raima earns 5 000 soms monthly, but it’s too little for increasing the assortment she has. A bigger volume of goods would attract more customers. She needs a loan in order to purchase more goods.
 
  --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Elsa is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a direct selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soaps, toothpaste,& beauty products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Adiba's Group

texts.en:
Adiba is a hardworking lady by nature. She stitches footballs to financially support her family. She receives orders from different football selling shops and fulfills the orders on time to earn income for her family. Her husband is a transport loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to deliver the items from one place to another. He has been operating this business for over 10 years. Through his good services, many customers approach him to deliver their items to their destinations.

Abida has 3 sons and a daughter. Her 2 elder sons are tailors by trade and sew men’s clothes. Her third son studies in 2nd standard while her daughter is only 4 years old. Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has gotten rough and rotten from constant use. He can’t put heavy loads in it and, as a result, his business is suffering. 
 
Abida is hopeful that a new cart will help her husband deliver more loads and to provide better services to his clients and make more income. Abida is a new loan user of Asasah. She is very confident that this step will bring good profits to her husband. She lives with her family in the area named Kalar abadi which is located in a city named Gujranwala. Gujranwala is a mid-sized city in Pakistan and known for its rice industry.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim P. was born in 1962 and lives in Kakaoh village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children – one is a laborer in Thailand, one is a basket maker, and the other attends a local public school. She and her husband, Mr. Ngorn Ngorl, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Ngorn Ngorl is also a construction worker. Mrs. Kim P. has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far away from their home. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Kim P. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad belongs to Gujranwala which is a mid-sized city in Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Kalar abadi with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here 8 years ago. Irshaad is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children: four are working while the last one, a daughter, stays at home and helps her mother in the daily household works. Irshaad's first two sons have a business of making & selling bed-sheets. The next son operates a grocery store and the youngest son works in a factory on low income. 

Irshaad is married to M. A., a daily wage labor. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons’ business. With the loan, they will buy thread in bulk to make more bed-sheets to sell. The increase in number of bed-sheets enables them to sell to more customers and to make more income. 

She is hopeful that an investment will take her sons’ business to a more profitable position. Irshaad is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Irshaad”.

loans.use: To buy thread for making bed-sheets to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer F. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Jennifer is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jennifer is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a general store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mr. Pen Bros Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people in Thnoas village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their families'  living.
Mr. Pen B. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He was born in 1972. He is a widower with four children, three of whom are studying in local public school, but the other one is too small to work or study. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell in order to support his family.   Besides farming, he is a laborer and rock breaker, too. He does very hard work, and yet he can earn only a little income. So Mr. Pen B. is applying for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding as well as pig food, to start a new business.  With the rest of the  loan, he is going to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig food, for breeding

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en: The six people who make up this group loan live in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their families' living. They have selected Mrs. Sou C. to became the group leader.  She was born in 1954.  She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land on which she grows rice to sell to support her family.   Besides farming,  Sou C. is also a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Sou C. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a weaver, while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn A. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Anelyn is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing passenger services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Anelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. 

Anelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey K. sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets, and cooking ingredients in front of her house. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works as a farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. This couple has two children who work in various jobs and they always share their profits to use for the family’s expenses. 

In the past, she was building her new bathroom, but it is still not complete because she lacks  funds for finishing. To solve this problem, Srey K. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to buy construction material such as cement, bricks, and wood for completing the building.

loans.use: To buy construction material such as cement, bricks, and wood for completing the building.

loans.name: Kin's Group

texts.en:
In Prasat village, Takeo province, this group consists of four people.  Mrs. Kin S. M. is the group leader.  She is 47 years old.  The other members  will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their families' standard of living. 
Mrs. Kin S. M. is a cake seller in her local village, where she is able to earn some income to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Suy Prum, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and grows rice to sell to support his family.  He is a furniture maker, too. This couple works hard, yet they can only earn a small income. So to improve their family's living, Mrs. Kin S. M. is seeking a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a cow for breeding in order to start a new business. 
She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending local public school.  The youngest one is a 4-year-old.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio R. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. Antonio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Mainly he plants and harvests corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Antonio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.

Antonio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 4th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
From Kompong Cham province, Pech H. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind his house. He raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, Pech H. also cultivates a rice crop on his farmland. His wife helps him in the farming business. They have three children, all of whom are single and still live under their care. 

Presently, Pech H. would like to request a loan for planting his dry-season rice field, but he doesn’t have funds as capital to do it yet. To deal with this situation, Pech H. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, seed for planting, and to buy a few sacks of pig feed to fatten his pigs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seed for planting, and also a few sacks of pig feed to fatten his pigs.

loans.name: Mr. Sam Pon Village Bank Group

texts.en: The twenty people in this loan group selected Mr. Sam P. to be the group's president. They live in Pech Changva village in Takeo province and joined together for a village bank loan to improve their families' standard of living. Mr. Sam P. and his wife, Mrs. CH. Chek, are farmers who own a one-and-a-half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell. Mr. Sam P. is seeking a loan to improve his rice production. He is a father of two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andrés de 22 años,  es un joven emprendedor que le ha gustado innovar en el mercado de la agricultura y la crianza de animales para su venta. 

Viendo en una zona urbana ha trabajado para que su proyección de tener una pollera se haga realidad. Comenzó con pocos pollos dándoles balanceados por esa buena administración ahora esta vendiendo los pollos y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00 todos los dais. Vende cada pollo a $ 7.20. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicación pero para seguir necesita comprar con el préstamo pollos y balanceados con vitaminas para tener  un pollera saludable.
texts.en:
Andrés, 22 years old, is a young entrepreneur who has enjoyed being innovative in the field of agriculture and raising animals for sale.

Living in an urban area, he has worked so that his dream of having a chicken farm could be reality. He started with a few chickens, feeding them a balanced diet. Because of this good care he is now selling chickens, and he works from 7 am until 1 pm every day. He sells each chicken for $7.20.

He has many aspirations for his business, so he wants to continue working at his business with dedication, but to continue he needs to use this loan to buy chickens and feed with vitamins in order to have a healthy chicken farm.

loans.use: Chickens, feed

loans.name: Mark Heller

texts.en:
Mark Heller D. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 46 years old. Mark Heller is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mark Heller owns and operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $690 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mark Heller joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Mark Heller is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be his 7th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy Z. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old. Teddy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Teddy owns and operates a service-based business, providing photocopying services in the local community. Teddy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $460 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teddy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teddy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. 

Teddy is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 4th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Savorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. has been selected president by the twelve members of this village bank loan group living in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeu Set, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. He is a construction worker. Mrs. Sao S. is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow to start a new business breeding cattle. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es: La señora Maribel tiene 31 años y vive en la zona D. Villa Hermosa en Huaycan, esta conviviendo y tiene un hijo, lleva cuatro años trabajando con Edaprospo en el grupo “Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa”, grupo conformado por 10 vecinos y amigos, además el grupo escogió el nombre indican: “Por que viven en la Villa y son hermosas”, La señora Maribel por su parte atienD. en un restaurante y venD. comida desD. hace 5 años, también venD. ropas D. temporada a pedido para así juntar dinero y poder en el futuro comprar su casa y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le siga brindando su ayuda.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribel is 31 years old and lives in the Villa Hermosa ["Beautiful Village"] zone of of Huayacan.  She is in a common-law marriage and has one son.  She has been working with Edaprospo for four years, with the "Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa" ["Little Flowers of Villa Hermosa"] group.  This group is maD. up of ten neighbors and friends.  They chose their group's name "because they live in the Villa and they are beautiful."

For her part, Ms. Maribel tends to a restaurant and has been selling food for five years.  In order to bring in enough money, she also sells seasonal clothing on order.  In the future, she wants to be able to buy her own house, so she needs the continued support that Edaprospo has offered her.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn K., 26, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs in a stall at her home. She is married to Voeurn, age 36, who assists her in the business. The couple has been married for years and they have three school-aged children, all living under one roof. 

With growing family expenses, Soeurn K. needs to increase her income. Soeurn K. requests a loan to purchase small pigs to raise and to buy pig feed to fatten them. By using this loan she will get more income and be able to support her family more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise, and feed for them.

loans.name: Mrs. Phann Nom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group is in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. Its eleven members have selected Mrs. Phann N., born in 1958, to be their president. The group members will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their standard of living. Mrs. Phann N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. In addition, she wants to breed pigs, but does not have enough money. So Mrs. Phann N. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets and pig food  to start a new business. With part of the loan she is going to hire farm laborers to harvest her rice. Her husband, Mr. ChH. Chheay, is a construction worker and a traditional musician who is able to earn some money to help support his family. They have three children, one of whom is employed in a private company, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the youngest one is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe B. is from the village of Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 32 years old. Leofe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of manufacturing and selling lampakanay products to local businesses and community members. (Editor's note: Twisted fibers from the lampakanay aquatic herb are twisted and woven, and are used to make baskets and to cover chairs, etc.). Leofe is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. 

Leofe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Margos Kapatagan, Aurora Zamboang Del Sur

loans.name: Susana Alexandra

texts.es:
Susana de 30 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres ya que para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos ya que no era casada tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para ganar mas dinero. 

En la actualidad esta administrando su propio negocio y trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm que termina la atención al publico. Vende todo tipo de productos a un valor muy económico para sus clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar para darle una buena vida a sus hijos y desea el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas etc. 

En el futuro quiere surtir la mercadería que vende y ubicar otra tienda en otro sector para tener mas ingresos y asi darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana, 30 years old, has a small grocery store so she can give her children a better life. Because she was not married, she had to invest her savings to earn more money.

Now she runs her own business and works from 6:30 am to 10 pm, when she closes. She sells all types of products at a very affordable price to her customers. She has many goals for her business and wants to continue so she can give her children a good life. She wants this loan to purchase rice, oil, beverages, etc.

In the future she wants to stock up on the merchandise she sells and open another store in another area so she can have more revenue, thereby giving her children a good life.

loans.use: Rice, oil, beverages

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es: Natividad es la presidenta del grupo “Las Esteritas” el cual se creó hace 1 año y se conforma por 11 vecinas, Ella a sus 66 años tiene 6 hijos y lleva 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo, ella mantiene su hogar con el alquiler D. su casa venD. huevos, cebollas, papas en la entrada D. su casa y pronto pondrá un negocio D. plastiqueria (venta D. productos D. plástico) pero para eso necesita que Edaprospo le siga brindando sus habilitaciones para así poder comenzar con un buen capital D. dinero.
texts.en: Natividad is the president of the Las Esteritas group, which formed a year ago and consists of 11 neighbors. She, 66 years old, has six children and has worked with Kiva partner Edaprospo for two years. She maintains her home by renting her house and by selling eggs, onions, and potatoes in the entryway of her house. Soon she will open a plastic products sales business, but to do this she needs Edaprospo to authorize her loan so she can start with good working capital.

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora que ha hecho lo posible para que sus tres hijos tengan lo que necesitan ya que es madre soltera ella comenzó a vender cosas y juguetes para ser una comerciante informal. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana a estado trabajando como comerciante informal. Vende ropa, bisutería, juguetes de todo tipo etc. Recorre las calles en la mañana y también le vende a sus vecinos y conocidos las mercadería que vende. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para tener su propio local pero aun no ha tenido la oportunidad de concretar su meta por eso trabaja con dedicación. 

Por ahora con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, ropa para diversificar su mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien construido.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who has made it possible for her three children to have what they need. Because she is a single mother, she started selling things and toys in order to be an informal merchant.

She is living in an urban area working as an informal merchant. She sells clothes, costume jewelry, all types of toys, etc. She sells on the street in the morning and also sells her merchandise to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has many aspirations to have her own store, but so far she has not had the opportunity to meet her goal, so she works with dedication.

For now, with this loan she wants to buy toys and clothes to diversify her merchandise. In the future she wants to have a nice store.

loans.use: Toys, clothes

loans.name: Amelita's Group

texts.en:
Amelita P. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Amelita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Blueberry.

Amelita is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of providing new clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T.  has three children aged 16, 14 and 3. She is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. Farming has been her family's source of income for more than a decade now. Lucia does her best to keep the farm productive. She wishes to have an extra source of income to help provide for her family's needs.

Lucia currently needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy what she needs for the farm.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chona Elvie

texts.en:
Chona Elvie S. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Chona Elvie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She also sells coconuts. Chona Elvie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Chona Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Chona Elvie is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and coconuts. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Chona Elvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

texts.en:
Edward is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. 

He has been in a retail shop for five years and his hardships include; debtors who take too long to pay, price fluctuations and high trading license fees. 

Nonetheless, his vision is to have a wholesale shop .Edward needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and cassava flour for sale.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and cassava flour to sell.

Azamat rents a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He is applying for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Romeo is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Romeo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

This time, Romeo decided to lower the amount of his loan from 11,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because it will be easier for him to pay back. This new loan will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miranie

texts.en:
Miranie E. is from the village of Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Miranie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Miranie plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Miranie has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Miranie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Miranie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Miranie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Marta is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products like dried fish and squid in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Marta is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried squid. This will be the fifth loan she has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
