loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 32 years old and married with two children aged 4 and 7. He owns a home in Hoima, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children up to university. 

He runs a business selling second-hand shoes and has been running it for 14 years amid the challenge of seasonal customers. His business goal is to relocate to a bigger shop in town. Vincent needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina W. is from the village of Brgy. Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Rosalina is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Juster

texts.en:
Juster, 76, is a widowed mother of 11 grown children. She is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 40 years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries and coffee through a local society.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter to chop hay. She says that this will help save time and reduce the wastage of fodder thus saving money. She hopes to increase her milk production from the current 20 to 50 litres in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en:
Myassar is a 58-year-old mother of two daughters and four sons. Two of her sons work in bakery in Jenin, while the other two sons work on the small farm the family owns. On this farm they raise dairy cows and sell the milk to families and shops in the area.

Myassar came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase an additional cow to the ones they have in order to increase the milk production and sales.
Myassar appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to increase the milk production and sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drugs for her business

loans.name: Rayhon

texts.ru: Аликулова Райхон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Райхон более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Целью кредита является закуп семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора. Она хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: A. Rayhon lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-eight years old, married and has three children. Her husband works in Russia. For over eight years Rayhon has raised plants, specifically vegetables, for sale. She's asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for her tractor. All this will enable her to reap a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Imbatuhon, Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Norma is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products like milkfish and sardines in the local community. She also runs a retail store selling junk food, beverages, and detergents. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like mackerel and salmon. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell, like mackerel and salmon

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children, who lives in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for 30 years. Her hardships include bad climatic changes and limited capital. Her vision is to have a big store for the produce. Sylvia needs the credit to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en: Erdene-Ochir is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, within his sibling's fence. All three of his children attend school. His wife is currently unemployed, while Erdene-Ochir operates a pickled vegetable and sausage trading business. He does not have any previous business experience and recently started his business after moving from Zavhan Province. For the future, he hopes to establish a stable and successful business. Erdene-Ochir is a clever and hardworking man and says, "I work very hard to expand my business further." He is requesting a 500,000-MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to sell for the upcoming holiday Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a 26-year-old married man with a child, who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He dreams of building his own house. He works in the transportation sector, riding a motorcycle, and has been in business for three years. The business is still profitable. His major challenge is having to remit part of his daily income to the owner of the motorcycle, and his desire is to own one. Sam needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Karatunga

texts.en: Karatunga is a 34-year-old married man with nine children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wish is to complete the construction of his residence. For eight years he has been in the taxi business, which has been very lucrative. Karatunga needs the loan to buy tires and service the car so as to be efficient in his business.

loans.use: To buy tires and service the taxi

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita A., from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 53 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three grown children. To make a living, Elsita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 11 years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products to sell including snack foods and detergents, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods & detergents

loans.name: Aberi

texts.en: Aberi is a 60-year-old married man with six children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children. Ten years ago, he stopped farming and began selling fish. He feels the idea was a good one, as he has reaped tangible benefits. Aberi needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 72-year-old single father of two children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to set up an income-generating activity for the family. He has been selling goats for five years, and this has helped him to generate money to provide the basics for his children. Andrew needs the loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is a 49-year-old single mother of three children. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream for her family is to educate her children to the university level. For the past 20 years, she has been selling clothes. She continues to reap tangible benefits from her business, even with the challenge of limited capital. Leonia needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en: Naranhuu is 59 years old and lives with her two children in an apartment in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her  daughter is disabled and her son is in primary school. She makes a living by owning and operating a grocery store where she sells a variety of food items to her customers. She opened the store in 2006 and has since built it into a successful and stable business. Today her daily average income exceeds 250,000 MNT and her monthly profit is between 400,000 and 500,000 MNT. She has one employee who is a salesperson and earns 300,000 MNT a month. Naranhuu is very hard working and determined to achieve her goals. She says, "I plan to repair my car in the near future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to improve her store and to buy a new refrigerator with glass door for groceries.

loans.use: To improve her store and repair her car

loans.name: Sherlita's Group

texts.en:
Sherlita M. lives in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon, Isabela. She is 48 years old and leads an eight-person loan group affiliated with ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sherlita is married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns about 9,000 PHP from her work.

In 2006, Sherlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, her ninth, to buy feed and other supplies she needs to run her business. She will use to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 63 years old, married to a midwife and has 10 children, all of whom live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is known for being very hard working and has made a living for the last 40 years by raising animals and selling milk. He has earned enough money to educate six of his children, and would like to improve his prospects further by setting up a ranch. He has applied for this loan to buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley S. lives in the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old, married, has five school-aged children and makes a living by operating a small retail store where people buy items they need daily, such as shampoo, soap, food and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than 12 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaird three previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 9,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods and detergent, to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 27 years old, married, has three children and lives in a house she rents in Kasese, Uganda. For the last five years, she has made a living selling cassava flour. She started with 200,000 shillings in capital and has increased that sum to 2,800,000 shillings. Despite many hardships and high transportation costs, her goal is to sell at least 100 bags of flour a week. She has applied for this loan to buy more cassava to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy of cassava flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Rubie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rubie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services as her husband as the driver to local community members. Rubie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rubie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service vehicle

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar T. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a house and fence. His two children attend a local school. Ganbaatar operates a clothing trade business. He sells a variety of clothing items and has gained a lot of experience in his trade. He has proven himself to be trustworthy to customers who paid off all his previous loan on time in full. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import a large amount of clothes from China in order to sell for upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday.

loans.use: To import a large amount of clothes

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en:
Marivic D. G. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 39 years old. Marivic is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Vivian

Vivian D. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Vivian is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan, 63, is married with 7 adult children. He has a mixed farm in Murang'a town, central Kenya, that produces milk and coffee. He has been in the farming business for over 30 years and employs one farmhand. 

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to construct a modern dairy unit. He says that this loan will enable him improve his dairy farming and his milk production since he will have proper management of his dairy cows. He plans to acquire at least 6 high-yielding dairy cows in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and improve his dairy farming.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and cheese cakes in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines and mackerel in the local community. loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad P. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Trinidad is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling cosmetics and clothing products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Trinidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Trinidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia hopes to increase her next harvest.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn D. G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 35 years old husband and father of three sons. Samer owns a small farm in Tulkarem and he also works in construction and farming to secure a better life for his three children. Samer works on the other side of the security wall which was  recently constructed. This made it very dangerous for workers like him to cross to the other side.

Samer wants to enlarge his farm in order to stop working in the land located on other side of the wall, Samer took a loan from FATEN to increase the number of goats and their milk production.  He appears in the picture here in his farm.

loans.use: Purchase more goats to increase the dairy production

loans.name: Mrs. Var Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Srae Vong village in Takeo Province live 14 people who comprise a village bank loan. Each will use their portion of the loan in order to improve their family living standards. Mrs. Var T., the village bank president selected by the other members, sells cakes in front of a public school, thereby earning money to support her family. Now she wants to start a cow-breeding business for which she is requesting a loan.

Var's husband, Mr. San Hem, is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school; their youngest is only a one-year-old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Samuel M. est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 38 ans, il est marié, et il est né a Rwanda.  Il a 5 enfants entre 1 an et 14 ans, et 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Samuel est soudeur avec a une éducation d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des portes, fenêtres, ciments, et sables pour la construction d’une maison à louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une autre maison pour avoir la maison à louer.  Samuel voudrait assurer la bonne vie pour sa famille.
texts.en: Samuel M. has been a client of ACB since 2007. He is 38, married, and was born in Rwanda. He has 5 children, between the ages of 1 and 14, 4 of whom go to school. He is a welder and attended primary school. He will use this loan to buy doors, windows, cement, and sand to build a house he will rent. To expand his business, his strategy is to build another house to rent. Samuel would like to ensure a good life for his family.

loans.use: Buying doors, windows, sand, cement

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 6 years. His mixed farm produces tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, and vegetables, which he sells locally. He is also employed as a casual laborer in the same region.

Joash has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay for his children's school fees and improve his family's livelihood. Joash faces the challenges of pests, diseases and lack of farm supplies such as fertilizers, all of which affect his production. Joash is 27 years old and married, with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 6.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mr. Neang Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:

Mr. Neang M. is a construction worker and bicycle repairer in the local village, earning some money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yoeun Chhet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to feed her family. Mr. Neang M. wants to start a new business, but doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy six piglets for breeding. Mr. Neang M. is the father of two children, both of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: to buy six piglets for breeding

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Norn P., 26, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populate city in the country. She sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 105 on food, 15 on the children’s education, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to purchase more groceries to expand her business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
